Job Description:
Our ideal candidate will be passionate about helping our enterprise customers and business teams across the globe, enjoy resolving problems, identifying root causes of issues, and thrive in a team environment
The incoming person would be responsible for end-to-end ticket resolution and communication with the customers and other stakeholders within the SLA, escalations to the internal teams based on SOPs, creation of internal knowledge based articles and perform engineering support activities as and when required
Responsibilities:
You will play a key role in the design and development of applications, including application security assessment, vulnerability assessment, penetration testing and source code review.
You will track the centralised log monitoring (SIEM) solution and monitor security feeds streaming from various sources, investigate intrusion attempts and perform in-depth analysis of exploits, indicators of compromise and other possible alerts generated by the SIEM tool.
You analyse a variety of network and host-based security appliance logs (Firewalls, NIDS, HIDS, Sys Logs, etc.) to determine the correct remediation actions and escalation paths for each incident, event analysis and must possess knowledge of operating systems, TCP/IP networking, network attacks, attack signatures, defence countermeasures, vulnerability management, and log analysis.
You will review and maintain network security on Zeotap and client VPCs, and suggest new security detection & protection solutions and tools to the Head of InfoSec.
You explore and operationalise new security tools and technology at Zeotap.
You conduct proactive threat research and offensive analysisYou actively participate in internal InfoSec compliance activities.
You analyse the vulnerabilities reported by independent security researchers via Zeotap s vulnerability disclosure program
You adhere to zeotap s company, privacy and information security policies and procedures
You complete all the awareness training assigned on time
Requirements:
6 months - 2 years of experience in performing Security and Network Operations activities
Good understanding of application security frameworks, vulnerability assessments and penetration testing (OWASP, SANS, PTES etc.)
Theoretical knowledge about Security Operations Centre (SOC), SIEM monitoring tools- log analysis, packet analysis and packet capture tools, TCP/IP networking, and reverse engineering.
Basic understanding of common databases and web technologies.
Good understanding of cloud security.
Knowledge on security testing tools like burp, nessus, metasploit.
Solid knowledge of computer networks and common protocols: TCP/IP, UDP, DNS, FTP, SSH, SSL/TLS, HTTP, and etc.
Proficiency in one or more programming/scripting languages (Python, Go, C/C++).
In-depth technical knowledge of Linux Operating Systems.
What we offer:
Competitive compensation & attractive perks
Health Insurance coverage
Flexible working support, guidance and training provided by a highly experienced team
Fast paced work environment
Work with very driven entrepreneurs and a network of global senior investors across telco, data, advertising, and technology
Keywords: C++, FTP, Linux, Testing tools, Information security, SOC, DNS, Network security, HTTP, Python

Help clients prepare for and respond to external audits and compliance assessments.
Information Security Audits:
Conduct information security assessments for clients, including risk assessments and Cybersecurity maturity assessments, compliance audits, Third-party audits, etc.
Identify security gaps, vulnerabilities, and risks in clients' IT infrastructure, systems, and processes.
Write good quality reports of security audits / assessments.

Own the security and be the go to person for anything related to application security.

Bring security in place with SDLC.
Proactively perform vulnerability assessments across all our products, infrastructure and help the development team to patch vulnerabilities.

Participating in design and architectural discussions.

Job Title: Cyber Security Threat Intelligence Analyst- Kuwait based
Job Description:

Handle the collection, analysis, and production of finished Threat Intelligence in support of Cyber Defense Technology, and additional lines of business.
Handle independent collection, analysis, and production of finished Threat Intelligence in support of Cyber Defense, Technology, and additional lines of business.
Collect information and conducting technical analysis to develop intelligence for the enterprise.
Maintain awareness of the global threat landscape and review complex, technical threat data, enrich it with contextual information and produce in finished intelligence Stakeholder consumption.
Conduct technical analysis and reporting that will influence proactive detection logic and methodology implemented within Cyber Defense.
Regularly collaborate with its Cyber Defense partners in Cyber Threat Detection, Active Defense, Digital Forensics and Incident Response, as well as the Cyber Defense Response Unit(s) to respond to incidents and aid in investigations.
Investigate security breaches and other cyber security incidents.
Document security breaches and assess the damage they cause.
Research security enhancements and make recommendations to management.
Stay up-to-date on information technology trends and security standards.

Experience with Threat Intelligence Platforms.
Experience in Digital Forensics.
Strong Understanding of firewalls, proxies, SIEM, antivirus, and IDPS concepts.
Knowledge and ability to identify threat actor attack methods and track their developments.
Experience in using the Diamond Threat Model or Cyber Kill Chain.
Experience in conducting threat modeling.
Experience working as Cyber Threat Analyst.

3/- years experience in information Security or related field.

Cyber Security Certifications: CEH, ECLPT, ECSA, OSCP, GCIA, CHFI etc.

The position is based in Kuwait based - Oil and Gas Sector.

Immediate joiners are preferable.

Job Description:
Role Description:
The Information Security Analyst is responsible for supporting the execution of the Information Security strategy. The Information Security Analyst provides data and analysis to measure the effectiveness of Information Security controls across group wide products and services. The Information Security Analyst identifies and evaluates potential areas of Information Security threats by assessing the probability and impact, and facilitates feedback for mitigation.
Roles within Information Security may cover one or more areas of speciality, e.g. Identity & Access Management (which may include, for example, authentication; access management & control; recertification etc.); Information Security (IS) Operations (which may for example include, cyber threat operations; cyber forensics, protection against data leakage etc.) and IS Technology (which may include IS architecture, IS engineering, cryptographic services etc.)
Overview
The DWS CSO I&A function designs, build, and operate strategic solutions for managing the request, approval, provision, revocation of privileged access and its recertification to ensure DWS stays compliant with internal and external controls and regulations.
We are in the process of building a IAM (Identity & Access Management solution) based on Forgerock and PAM (Privileged Access Management) solution based on CyberArk Technology in the Cloud
What well offer you
As part of our flexible scheme, here are just some of the benefits that youll enjoy
Best in class leave policy
Gender neutral parental leaves
100% reimbursement under childcare assistance benefit (gender neutral)
Sponsorship for Industry relevant certifications and education
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family members
Comprehensive Hospitalization Insurance for you and your dependents
Accident and Term life Insurance
Complementary Health screening for 35 yrs. and above
Your key responsibilities:
Execute Manual ID admin requests
Support all IAM or PAM related governance processes, e. g. operational run of Campaign recertifications, Detective SoD, On-boarding of accounts and applications
Execute compensating controls where IT implementation is not yet ready
Understand and define requirements and business processes
Support the Access Lifecycle processes for the strategic solution as well as compensating controls for tactical solutions
Understand and proactively manage operational, regulatory, and other risks related to the service
Support maintenance of IAM and PAM information assets across the organisation, including documentation, catalogues and risk assessments
Support UAT and Functional Testing of the IAM solution

Your skills and experience:
Knowledge of IAM and PAM processes and solutions
1 to 2 years of experience in Information Security, specifically Identity and Privileged Access Management
Understand the large scale thinking and approach of a global service
Proven experience in an ID administration role
Proven experience in an IAM Business Analyst role
Attention to detail and able to deliver high quality material to agreed timeframes
Good understanding of Information Security Control frameworks
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong relationship management and communication skills
Knowledge of the financial services industry and its compliance issues is a plus
Keywords: Security Analysis, risk assessments, Information Security Control, Privileged Access Management, IAM, ID administration, UAT, Functional Testing

Job Description:
Role & responsibilities

Primary mandate skill required IT/OT Security ( forcescout)
Secondary mandate skill required Firewall and Proxy.
Today the modern enterprise is an Enterprise of Things. We are on a mission to secure the Enterprise of Things with active defense by identifying, segmenting and enforcing compliance of every connected thing. In real time. And at scale. Our unified security platform enables enterprises and government agencies to focus on Zero Trust segmentation, IT/OT convergence and OT/ICS innovation, all supporting our mission and vision.
Join us as we secure the world with our products. We are looking for resourceful and gritty individuals to collaborate as one team while ensuring a world-class customer experience. We are cyber-obsessed about addressing the worldÃÂs most challenging security problems. Innovation starts here, everyoneÃÂs ideas are valued, visionaries welcomed!

What You Will Do:
Bring your top qualities as a cyber security analyst to impact ForescoutÃÂs product directly;
Develop the inherent algorithms to be used in ForescoutÃÂs products;
Identify and research new innovative methodologies and technologies that could improve our security engines;
Work with a group of security researchers and data scientists to analyze unique context-rich endpoint and network traffic data collected through our cloud platform;
Develop advanced techniques to classify IoT devices and detect anomalous behavior;
Identify additional data sets that can be useful in refining and enhancing ForescoutÃÂs IoT security engine;
Keep being updated in the cyber-security landscape: threat intelligence, academic papers, news, forums, and technical blogs;
Research new and existing cyber-security attack techniques and territories, while evaluating detection tactics;
Identify and evaluate potential security breaches that currently exist and may pose a potential threat to customersÃÂ networks.
Understanding of NetSec like Palo Alto Firewall, Cisco FTD and Proxy will be added advantage.
What You Bring to us
2+ years of experience in industry/army cyber-security research or analysis.
In-depth knowledge of networking and Internet protocols.
Hands-on experience in information security tools and attack methodologies.
Familiarity with cybersecurity frameworks (CIS, NIST CFS, MITRE ATT&CK).
Experience with network/security-related data analysis.
Hands-on experience in software development or scripting languages.
Practical research enthusiastic - delivering continuous solutions for real challenges and threats.
Practical Machine-Learning / Data Science experience - a major advantage
Similar position in cyber-security firm ÃÂ a major advantage

Job Description:
The position ensures all designated Saviynt monitoring tasks are reviewed/reassigned/reported and appropriate action taken per defined procedure in scheduled time frame
Assist AccessHub level 3 engineering team to enhance and test Access Hub request system, provides support for weekend sprints and Access Hub application upgrades
Schedule jobs monitoring/reporting by raising incidents and JIRA tickets
Ensures certifications and revocations are monitored, reassigned and closed within the defined service level objective
Reported issues to be tracked via CAIR Log, reported to L3 engineering team, and discussed on daily stand-up calls
The position is also responsible for workload balancing request, addressing High risk termination Service now tickets, perform analysis on manual tasks like workload, pending reassignment and projects to help efficiency gains in operations
Not filling this position will negatively impact IAM Operations ability to service the needs and expectations of our clients and business partners, as well as increase the potential reputational and financial risk
The position will liaise with business, application owners to help onboard new application in to IAM operations
Create/update/review operational playbooks to maintain business continuity
Assign Saviynt queues to newly onboarded applications
Create access for staff and share updates whenever any change is incorporated within applications
The position is critical to ensure the ability to meet project milestones, adherence to BNYM Automation guidelines and framework, IAM Info
Sec policies and enhance service level objectives through automation implementation
Accountabilities will also include automating internal & external employee access provisioning associated with onboarding new applications and responsibilities, escalate issue and maintain CAIR Logs
Support Level 2 activities for Automation tracks within IAM Ops
This position is critical for maintaining controls related to internal and external identity management
This requisition is critical to meeting both project deliverables as well as maintaining operational service levels
Not filling this position would leave a significant gap in 2023 aggressive automation project deliverables and is critical to meeting deadlines and provide evidence on time for scope change and maintaining defined project service levels
Replacement resource will be a member of a cross functional team, resource will support manual access provisioning, priority access request, workload balancing function, AccessHub monitoring for provisioning queue failures and will be exposed to all aspects and phases of API/Connector automation and RPA by leveraging Agile methodology including analyzing the automation requirements, process design and documentation, dividing the project into different sprints, allocating sprints to development team and completing the BOT life cycle in more agile way
Supports the effectiveness of security-related operations
Provides programming support and assists in project planning for an operational area in information security
Supports the operations of a security sub-component
Executes day-to-day operational security components
Implements new versions of security software for existing technologies and architectures
Reviews and analyzes data and information for business systems security
Assists in ensuring that security concerns are addressed and mitigated
Produces first draft of reports, analyses, findings, etc
Contributes to the achievement of team objectives
Bachelors degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required
2-4 years of experience in information security or related technology experience required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus

Job Description:
The advanced threats, risks and security vulnerabilities of the companys IT and digital solutions are known and evaluated.
A technical watch is done to anticipate the evolution of the risks.
The safety requirements and their implementation are a good compromise between the costs, the acceptance by the users and the level of residual risk.
The tools and methods needed to ensure the security of IT and digital projects and solutions are implemented to control the level of risk.
Serious security incidents are resolved.
His/Her actions contribute to improving the behavior of people (users of IT and digital solutions, managers, professionals of IT and digital solutions) facing constantly changing security risks and threats.
Continuously looks for ways to evaluate and reduce risk to the company, and to improve security processes & methods
Continuously enlarges breadth of knowledge (technical & business related) through internal and external contacts
Perimeter:
The scope is Worldwide.
The Security Analyst is part of the Infra/NET team.
The main missions are:
Control the level of security on our NET devices.
Provide reports and key indicators.
Be accountable for the corrections and follow-up.
The main activities are:
Use the work instructions to build the weekly and monthly reports.

Build the indicators each month.

Job Description:
Your role as a Cybersecurity Specialist is critical in safeguarding Tntras digital assets and ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of its data and services
This position requires a well-rounded individual with a comprehensive set of skills and knowledge to proactively identify and mitigate security threats, vulnerabilities, and risks across a wide range of technology platforms and environments
Your role as a Cybersecurity engineer is critical in enhancing the security posture of Tntra by applying industry best practices and staying ahead of emerging cybersecurity trends
Roles Responsibilities
Strong Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Proficient in critical thinking and decision-making, even when faced with limited information.
Excellent Communication and Interpersonal Skills: Exceptional verbal and written communication abilities for effective collaboration with internal teams and external stakeholders or clients.
Penetration Testing: Proficiency in conducting penetration testing with experience in web application and/or API/mobile pen testing, ideally encompassing at least OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities or, even better, OWASP ASVS.
Development Methodologies and Secure Coding Practices: Good understanding of development methodologies and secure coding practices.
Network Protocols, Operating Systems, and Security Technologies: Great understanding of network protocols, operating systems, and security technologies.
Tool Proficiency: Should have proficiency in tools like Burp Suite Professional, Nessus, Frida, Objection, and MobSF.
DevSecOps Knowledge: Good understanding of DevSecOps methodologies, including SAST (Static Application Security Testing), SCA (Software Composition Analysis), and DAST (Dynamic Application Security Testing).
Cybersecurity Policy and Procedure Development: Assist in developing and refining cybersecurity policies and procedures to enhance the overall security posture of products/services.
APIs and Reporting Tools: A broad knowledge of APIs and reporting tools and experience with their integration is an added advantage for the role.
Cloud Security Knowledge: In-depth knowledge of cloud security features and configuration.
Industry Certifications: Possession of industry certifications such as training for eWPT (eLearnSecurity Web-Application Penetration Tester), eJPT (eLearnSecurity Junior Penetration Tester), PNPT (Practical Network Penetration Tester), OSCP (Offensive Security Certified Professional), or other relevant certifications is highly desirable.
Continuous Learning: We ensure you stay updated with the latest cybersecurity trends, tools, and techniques, fostering personal and team knowledge improvement. We believe in knowledge sharing and expect the same from you in a continuous learning and growing environment.
Education Background
While not mandatory, a bachelors degree in psychology, data science, mathematics, computer science, information security, or a related field, or equivalent work experience, would be an asset
Keywords: Career development, Penetration, Coding, Soft skills training, Information security, Web application, Nessus, Reporting tools, Penetration testing

Job Description:
Components include: DNS, DHCP, AD, SMTP, SNMP, NTP, PKI. Firewalls and AAA solutions. F5 (LTM AFM/WAF/ASM) Experience: 5 -10 Years of experience in the Network Security domain. Roles and Responsibilities: Hands on Experience in Authority and Cache DNS. Knowledge of creation of Zones, A record, PTR Entry, Zone file compilation, etc.
 Knowledge of DNS tunneling, NS server, Root server related troubleshooting technique, delegation provisioning and troubleshooting techniques are must. Analytical skills of abuse and anomalies in DNS traffic, DNS and DDoS attack experience is plus. Provisioning knowledge on Views, Deletion, and various types of DNS records. Hands on experience in DHCP Protocol and knowledge of the DHCP message flow. Ability to troubleshoot the IP allocation and Failover issue from the logs. Working experience on AAA/Radius(Cisco ISE AAA)
Protocols and strong knowledge of AAA call flow, Policy. Hand on experience on Cisco ISE with device administration. Device & user based authentication/Authorization from ISE. BYOD configuration. Hand on experience on Cisco ISE which includes the Creation of rules for user access to devices, user and device management. Basic knowledge of CNF, VNF, VMware and Cloud based architecture and operations experience is plus. Experience with other common protocols and services (FTP, TFTP, NTP, SNMP, syslog, Loadbalancers(F5) etc.) Hand on experience on F5 LTM/AFM/ASM/ WAF and have good knowledge of Tshoot skills. Firewall Installing, Configuring & troubleshooting Cisco ASA Firewall (ie, Packet tracer & Packet capture).
VPN Configuring & Troubleshooting Site to Site IPSEC VPN, Remote Access VPN. UNIX system administration, preferably including Source, Centos, Linux, Solaris, and VMware certification is plus Good understanding of Linux command and Tshoot the skills. Knowledge of Web services, Scripting, and Database Management experience is plus. End to end responsible for the incident and for its notification to relevant stakeholders/interfaces and status reporting and follow up on TT from its creation until the incident has been solved and TT closed. Good team player and willing to work 24*7 shift basis.
Keywords: Unix, VMware, FTP, Linux, Solaris, DNS, SNMP, Network security, DHCP, System administration

Job Description:
Role Overview
The Cyber Security Solution Engineerworks in the frontline of the sales process with customers. In this exciting role, you can make an impact by working with customers to implement one of the worlds most advanced XDR systems. While being part of a highly skilled team of specialists, that cover endpoints, network, cloud and security analysts, you will take the customer on journey to deploy the solution, connect and embed it into the customers IT tools and processes and demonstrate the value of state-of-art and AI-based cyber security detection and response.
In this process, you are responsible for and end-to-end delivery of the platform: from intake, evaluation of success criteria, onboarding and demonstrating value by analysing alerts, performing threat hunts, cyber attack simulations and more.
Your broad experience in this field will allow you tosupport prospects with the deployment, configuration and troubleshooting of endpoint agents, network sensors, cloudand API integrations. This role requires expertise in these fields to anticipate and overcome potential deployment challenges.During the PoC you will have regular meetings with the prospect to explain details on the platform, analyse security alerts and to deliver success.
Being part of the Labs & Simulations team, you will also be part of delivering Interactive Demos, where attacks are simulated in a real time lab. Utilizing an on-demand generated lab environment, that includes both an attack machine, victim machines and network, you can show the value of an OpenXDR platform that is capable to detect nation state adversaries.
Team success comes from collaboration, both within the team as with other teams and from continuous improvement, knowledge sharing, process optimization while being supported by SMEÃÂs and Product Support.
Role Responsibilities
Collaborate with the Sales Engineer team to discuss customer requirements and success criteria to deliver
Install, configure, and deploy endpoint agents, network sensors, and other components of the Taegis XDR solution
Integrate Taegis XDR with customer SaaS applications,APIs and leverage Taegis XDR automations to deliver customer requirements
Build required reports with the build-in report generator and PowerBIcustom dashboards
Analyse security alerts and build investigations
Provide technical support to customers during the PoC deployment and testing process
Maintain documentation related to the deployment and configuration of Taegis XDR
Have regular calls with the customer to initiate the PoC, provide regular updates and a conclusion call
Partner with other lab and simulation stakeholders throughout Secureworks, including CTU, Incident Response, SecOps, Adversary Group
Collaborate with Product Engineering on new capabilities and configuration options
Define, document, and perform best practices and strategies regarding lab deployment and maintenance
Analyze and identify areas of improvement with management and related operations processes, procedures, and documentation
Understand the current CyberSecurity Platform application infrastructure
Continuously learn and stay up-to-date on the latest technologies, tools, and methodologies related to Taegis XDR and endpoint/network security
Work effectively in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment

Requirements
Enjoy working with customers
Excellent communication skills and proficiency in English
Solid presentation skills
Hands-on admin experience with automation integrationswith for example ITSMÃÂs such as ServiceNow and Zendesk;Pagerduty; Atlassian products and others
Effective troubleshooting mindset and problem solving skills to resolve system, script and functional errors
Hands-on experience with EDR and/or AI based Next Generation AV solutions (EPP)
Should beproficientin at least, preferably two of the following domains:
Cloud Computing (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)

High level Cloud architecture
Experience with commonly used cloud services (VPC, EC2, S3, Azure Compute and Firewall)
SaaS API integrations (Crowdstrike, SentinelOne, Office 365, OKTA)

Network & System Administration

Threat Hunting

Preferred Skills

Experience with configuring andmaintaining cloud-native applications
Experience with Microsoft O365 management
Knowledge of enterprise logging for OS, applications & various security technologies
Experiencewith the following scripting tools: Python, Json, Powershell and Bash

Take a look at what we offer and feel free to reach out to us for more details!

Job Description:
As part of the Professional Services team, the Information Security Consultant plans, organizes, and conducts information security consulting assignments for our customers, and consults on internal projects as required. The Information Security Consultant performs assessments of the client organization s information security posture and provides general information security advice and
guidance. Responsibilities include collaboration with other Hitachi Systems Security staff to share knowledge and practices to improve organizational practices.
Job Roles responsibilities:
(A) Plan and conduct information security consulting engagements. Engagements may include:
Analyzing the requirements for, designing and developing security policies and standards.
Designing, developing implementing information security management system initiatives such as security governance and strategy setting, security incident response and handling plans and security awareness.
Performing cyber security posture assessment
Performing security threat assessments
Operational knowledge and hands on experience implementing best practices standards such as ISO 27000, COBIT, NIST, PCI DSS, GDPR and other security control frameworks.
Work directly with customers, both to develop work plans and executing consulting engagements.
Engage clients in workshops, interviews, surveys, and data collection to perform assessments.
Comfortable delivering security awareness to clients.
Ability to apply abstract concepts to produce customer solutions.
Ability to work independently on assignments.
Develop deliverables in accordance with work plans developed collaboratively with clients.
Develop well-written, well-structured, accessible, and useable deliverables, for both client and internal audiences.
Work with the Project Managers to produce status reports and manage your time within the defined effort and duration project plans.
Contribute to the ongoing development of knowledge and practices within Hitachi Systems
Security, to enhance our services available to our customers.
Participate in professional development activities, focused on information security, including the pursuit of designations such as CISSP, CEH, and others.
Participate in pre-sales discussion with clients when scoping projects and developing proposal.
Perform technical reviews of proposals and RFP responses.
Other duties, as assigned.
Required Qualifications Skills:
Minimum of two (2) years of information security consulting, or related services, with a strong technical background.
Bachelor s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related discipline
Strong experience in enterprise risk management, security policies and controls, and information security strategy and architecture
Strong experience in governance, risk and compliance; security policies and controls; and information security frameworks and standards
Desire and dedication to pursue relevant professional designations and training.

Experience communicating with clients and internal management.
Outstanding organizational skills, able to multi-task on multiple projects at one time
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French
Ability to work to demanding deadlines.
Ability to manage your time efficiently.
High level of motivation to achieve desired results
Proven ability to prioritize tasks effectively, with attention to detail.
Be a team player who can work effectively with your peers and management.
Travel may be required.

Job Description:
John Crane is looking for dynamic, innovative and motivated Cyber Security Engineer to be the part of its global digital team in Technology group
The purpose of this role is to develop, sustain and enhance organization s cyber security architecture of across all the products and digital applications
The position is based in Bangalore
The Cyber Security Engineer is part of the global digital and architecture group, working closely with Products & Technology, Sales, Program Management, Service and overall business management to deliver successful pursuit outcomes and grow customer engagement, intimacy and our opportunity pipeline
This person uses skills to contribute to development of company objectives and principles and to achieve goals in creative and effective ways
He/she Applies advanced technical principles, theories, and concepts and is viewed as an expert within the company
The role also requires engagement with third party providers of cyber security, software and hardware to develop a complete solution that complements the John Crane product range and expands the market share for same
Duties & Responsibilities
Assist and enable engineering teams to adopt secure development practices
Develop software security guidance including training material, best practices, secure coding checklists, reusable code, etc
Work with application and product teams to detect, prioritize, and remediate security defects throughout the SDLC process. Strive to develop a security mindset throughout the full SDLC from concept to testing and implementation.
Perform internal product security assessments as needed. This may involve threat modeling, security design reviews, high level application penetration testing, and security issue remediation verification
Monitor and research industry information sources for zero-day threats and emerging security trends and vulnerabilities impacting the organization
Helps to execute Cyber Security vision, blueprint, strategy..
Plans security systems by evaluating network and security technologies in both OT and IT space.
Maintains security by monitoring and ensuring compliance to standards, policies, and procedures; conducting incident response analyses; developing and conducting training programs.
Prepares system security reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends.
Design, develop and deliver presentations focused on raising awareness for crucial security relevant considerations and defensive programming techniques
The Individual
What youll definitely need:
Must possess at least a Bachelor s degree in Electrical/Electronics Engineering and/or Computer Engineering/Science or equivalent.
Should possess at least 5 years of hands on work experience as a software and cyber security analyst.
Must possess strong security experience a strong fundamental expertise and experience in security penetration testing / research, application architectures and technology, knowledge in OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities, web application vulnerabilities and web application business logic flaws and threats, cloud security standards, secure code analysis, secure SDLC, and securing enterprise multi-platform systems, agile development, and emerging technologies
Hands-on experience in implementing DevOps and CICD (Continuous Integration Continuous Development) Circle CI, Jenkins, GitHub, etc
Strong foundation in security technologies such as Web Security, Cloud services, Identity/Access Management, Web Application Firewalls, Intrusion detection etc
Familiarity with Virtualisation and Cloud technology Vmware, AWS & Azure, Google Cloud platform and services etc
Experience with one or more of the following tools nmap, wikto, nessus, whisker, crowbar, Paros, suru, Wireshark, TCPDump, ISS is a plus
Experience with one or more of the following web app scanners - IBM AppScan (WatchFire), HP Web Inspect (SPIDynamics), Cenzic, Web Scarab is a plus
Very good knowledge of system, network and application infrastructure design eg fog or edge computing, networking design, virtualization, containers and cloud native design.
Should have worked in Agile software development environment.
Experience in digital development/Security Operations end use market understanding the customer needs and the solution requirements preferred
Security related certifications a plus
The motivation & ability to persistently pursue and achieve effective results which drive the business forward.
The ability to make effective, timely decisions in a complex, global market by sourcing and analyzing critical information.
The understanding and recognition of the organizations commercial environment and positioning themselves, their role and their actions in order to support the organizations commercial success.
The ability to engage, challenge and work effectively with others
Keywords: VMware, Coding, Access management, OWASP, Agile, Customer service, Security operations, SDLC, Penetration testing, WireShark

Job Description:
All employees have a responsibility to co-operate in promoting and maintaining a safe and healthy working environment, and to take reasonable care of their own health and safety at work and that of all other staff that may be affected by their acts or omissions. Line managers have specific responsibility for the health and safety of their direct reports and other team members for which they have general management responsibility.
All employees are also responsible for supporting and implementing the company s policies and procedures around the Health and Safety, Security, Quality and Business Continuity arrangements that apply in their role/work function. Full details of these policies and procedures are available on SharePoint.
Be the point contact for international client for specific security related requests.
Identify areas of opportunities and take initiatives to improve process efficiency.
Ensure that security standards are maintained and that security objectives are being met or exceeded.
Work under minimum supervision and act as an escalation point for the global client
Highlight any additional opportunities and possible quality, security or Health & Safety trouble areas to the reporting manager.
Key Activities
Handle client security requests within defined timelines.
Ensure adherence to committed turn-around times
Provide necessary exam footage to clients for further review.
Maintain accurate documentation for all client requests received and fulfilled.
Identifying and preventing exam fraud & infringement through review of candidate biometrics and other data points for the corresponding exam footages requested.
At all times, throughout all tasks, request support, guidance and assistance as required from colleagues and manager.
Effective and timely completion of objectives, reviews, reporting and accurate administration as required by manager.
Investigating client security incidents and risks
Continual Improvement.
Make recommendations for technology and process improvements to support security policies and initiatives.
Closely work with manager for handling any client escalations and support process initiatives
Essential Experience & Qualifications
Good working knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite and associated packages including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access and Internet packages. Vocational experience in a similar environment.
Ability to follow detailed procedures and ensure a high level of accuracy in documentation and data.
Ability to take responsibility for actions, a self-starter who can work well in a dynamic environment.
Prioritization skills and experience of dealing with multiple projects in a structured way.
Experience in a client facing environment, where ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction is essential.
Ability to establish rapport and deal with people at varying levels, both internally and externally.
Good communication skills, both written and oral.
Ability to work in a team structure.
Desirable Experience & Qualifications
Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience in related fields
Should have a minimum of 1-3 year work experience.
Keywords: Biometrics, Data management, Process efficiency, Manager Technology, Equity, Business continuity, Marketing communication, Information technology, Testing, Recruitment

Job Description:
6 or more years of experience in security operations roles, such as Security Analyst or Security Engineer.
Work timing / shift will be 9-5pm California time.
Security Monitoring : Continuously monitor security alerts and events to identify potential security incidents or threats.
Incident Response : Develop and implement incident response plans to address security breaches and mitigate potential damage.
Security Tools Management : Manage and maintain security tools such as intrusion detection systems (IDS), security information and event management (SIEM) systems, and firewall rules.
a.Monitoring of Qradar SIEM and investigating/closing out offenses
b.Experience investigating Palo Alto Cortex XDR alerts
c.Experience with tuning Qradar SIEM is a plus
d.Microsoft Office 365 Email Security and Azure related experience is a plus
Vulnerability Assessment : Conduct regular vulnerability assessments and penetration testing to identify and remediate security weaknesses.
Threat Intelligence : Stay updated on the latest cybersecurity threats and trends to proactively defend against emerging threats.
Security Policy and Compliance : Ensure compliance with security policies, standards, and regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, ISO 27001).
Security Documentation : Maintain documentation of security procedures, incident reports, and security policies.

Qualifications:
Education: A bachelor's degree in computer science, information security, or a related field is often required. Some employers may prefer candidates with master's degrees or relevant certifications.
Certifications: Certifications such as Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), or CompTIA Security+ can be beneficial.
Technical Skills: IBM Qradar, Palo Alto Cortex, Microsoft 365 email Security, Azure
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills to investigate security incidents and identify root causes.
Communication Skills: Effective communication skills are essential for documenting incidents and explaining security concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: The ability to think critically and solve complex security issues.
Teamwork: Collaboration with IT teams and other departments to implement security measures and respond to incidents.
Adaptability: The cybersecurity landscape is constantly evolving, so being adaptable and staying current with emerging threats is crucial.
Keywords: Computer science, Cism, Information security, ISO 27001, SIEM, microsoft, Security operations, Vulnerability assessment, Firewall, Penetration testing

Job Description:
Monitoring alerts for potential security incidents and requests for information. This includes, but not limited to monitoring of real-time channels, tools, dashboards, periodic reports, chat sessions, and tickets.
Following incident-specific procedures to perform basic triage of said potential security incidents to determine their nature and priority and eliminate obvious false positives and process requests for information.
Escalating potential security incidents to senior analysts and implement countermeasures/mitigating controls.
Coordinating with stakeholders with supporting third party security service providers to triage alerts, events or incidents.
Monitoring and analyzing Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) to identify security issues for remediation.
Knowledge of creating Security Information Event Management (SIEM) policy rulesets.
Recognizing potential, successful, and unsuccessful intrusion attempts and compromises thorough reviews and analyses of relevant event detail and summary information.
Interfacing with a variety of customers in a polite, positive, and professional manner.
Documenting all actions taken in a ticketing system

Requirements

Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science / Information Security / Information Technology
Proven track record and experience of the following in a highly complex and global organization:
Analyzing detected security events
Performing triage of potential security incidents
Experience with the technologies including, but not limited to SIEM, IDS/IPS, Network/Host based firewalls, data leakage prevention (DLP).
Understanding of possible attack activities such as network probing/ scanning, DDOS, malicious code activity, etc.
Experience scripting in a major language (python/bash/powershell)
Alternating weekend shift
Willing to work on any of three shifts to offer 24 hours support service.
Understanding of common network devices such as routers, switches.
Understanding of basic networking protocols such as IP, DNS, HTTP.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Self-motivated to improve knowledge and skills.
A strong desire to understand the what / why / how of security incidents.
Understanding of security-related areas (e.g. Malware re-engineering, Cloud Security, Phishing, Deception etc)
Benefits
Tower continues to enhance the in-house trading system and strategies that have positioned the firm as a leader in the thriving field of quantitative trading. While Tower offers challenges and rewards rivaling those of any Wall Street firm, Tower s cubicle-free workplace, jeans-clad workforce, and well-stocked kitchens reflect the premium the firm places on quality of life. Benefits include:
Competitive salary and discretionary bonuses
5 weeks of paid vacation per year
Breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks on a daily basis
Cab facility within Gurgaon
Health club allowances
Free events and workshops
Donation matching program

Job Description:
We are looking for a Senior Information Security Analyst to join our Information Security team onsite at our Bangalore office with the opportunity to work a hybrid schedule in the future reporting to the senior manager of Security Operations. In this role, you will work at a lead level, proactively identifying and tracking the remediation of security vulnerabilities along with Infoblox s Security Operations team. You will routinely interact with Security Operations Center (SOC) team members, architects, and other business leaders and decision makers. Your ability to lead and influence will be relied on as you identify solutions and make recommendations to primary stakeholders. This is a global position, which will work with the U.S.-based Security Operations team.
You are the ideal candidate if you enjoy developing and improving processes, operating independently but also collaboratively, and continually learning new things. You are a self-starter, highly motivated, and able to handle competing priorities. You are also an expert in building strong matrixed teams through remote collaboration.
What you ll do:
Monitor and act on cybersecurity alerts affecting the corporate infrastructure
Create metrics and assist the SOC manager as a technical lead in one or more areas
Participate in Incident Response events as they occur
Participate in and/or lead threat hunting exercises
Participate in Purple teaming events
Contribute to documenting and managing technical risks in the IT Risk Register
Create and improve security documentation, including process documents, run books, proposals, etc.
Present and communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences
Interact with multiple teams across the organization
Mentor junior staff members
What you ll bring:
8 years of experience with multiple technology solutions, such as SIEM, EDR, NDR, and ASM, and a wide array of cybersecurity disciplines
Knowledge of at least one industry regulatory framework or commercial security standard, such as NIST 800-53, NIST CSF, SOC2, or ISO 27001
Exceptional leadership skills, with the ability to influence without formal authority and the ability to work effectively with a diverse range of individuals, groups, and management levels
Superior project management and time management skills
Enjoyment of a fast-paced environment and the ability to work well under pressure
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving capabilities when faced with complex challenges
Excellent verbal communication and writing skills and experience creating documentation, including using Visio, Signavio or LucidCharts to capture process flows in readable diagrams
Bachelor s degree in engineering, information science, data science or equivalent
Preferred cybersecurity certifications: CISSP, GIAC certifications such as GMON, GSOC, and GCIH, CompTIA Security+, etc.
What success looks like:
After six months, you will
Understand the structure of Infoblox business units and critical applications and infrastructure which must be protected
Independently lead the SOC in the manager s absence
Have operational knowledge of 3-4 monitoring applications used by Security Operations
After about a year, you will
Have operational knowledge of all applications used by Security Operations, with in-depth knowledge of two or more applications
Develop KPIs to validate the success of the Security Operations program
Provide leadership and mentoring to junior staff
Keywords: remediation, IT risk, Project management, Analytical, ISO 27001, Security services, Wellness, Visio, Security operations, Operations

Job Description:
The primary responsibilities for this position will include applying your knowledge of various regulations and frameworks to complete risk assessments and where required, develop policy, procedures, and process documentation following industry regulations and standards. These activities will include one or more of the following:
Conduct NIST CSF security risk assessments for healthcare client organizations using the IH HIPAA One Platform outlining security risks for the given organization while establishing current security tiering and maturity levels.
Conduct HIPAA Security Risk Analysis for client organizations physical, administrative, and technical safeguards per the HIPAA Security Rule and relevant security framework(s) using the IH HIPAA One solutions platform.
Conduct HIPAA Privacy and Breach Risk Analysis for client organizations per the HIPAA Privacy and Breach Notification Rules and relevant privacy framework(s) using the IH HIPAA One solutions platform.
Conduct third-party risk assessments for clients utilizing the IH BluePrint Protect TPRM tool, based upon required needs in accordance with applicable security framework directives and regulatory requirements.
Opportunity to host webinars and author relevant blogs, articles, whitepapers, etc.
Lead working sessions and interviews with clients to capture existing process details and relevant policies and procedures.
Participate in regulatory and framework assessments by working closely with other team members to guide clients through their journey of compliance and framework adoption.
Key Skills Required:
Bachelor s Degree in Business, Management of Information Systems, or equivalent experience
Additionally, one or more certification in information security domain is preferred.
CISSP
PMP
HCISPP
Security
Keywords: Administration, PMP, Information Security Analyst, PDF, HIPAA, Lead, Healthcare, Business management, Subject Matter Expert, Risk analysis

Job Description:
Greetings from TSIT Digital !!


This is with regard to an excellent opportunity with us and if you have that unique and unlimited passion for building world-class enterprise software products that turn into actionable intelligence, then we have the right opportunity for you and your career.


This is an opportunity for Permanent Employment with TSIT Digital


What are we looking for: Mainframe Cybersecurity Engineer

Experience : - 5+

Notice Period : 0-15/ Immediate

Location : Bangalore , Hyderabad, Pune, Chennai( work from the office 3 days a week)

Mandatory Skills : Mainframe Cyber security engineer with RACF

Job Description :
Participate in efforts related to designing, planning, enhancing, and testing all cybersecurity technologies used throughout the enterprise including base-lining current systems, trend analysis, and capacity planning as required for future systems requirements and new technologies.
2. Participate in the analysis of information to determine, recommend, and plan the use of new technologies, or modifications to existing equipment and systems that will provide capability for proposed project or workload, efficient operation, and effective use of allotted resources.
3. Participate in the implementation of new information security technologies or integration of existing technologies including initial configuration, installation, change management, and operational handoff.
4. Take a new perspective on existing solutions to solve complex problems and exercise judgment based on the analysis (e.g. modeling, testing, etc.) from multiple sources of information.
5. Provide technical support of information security technologies, providing problem analysis and resolution in a timely manner and explain and interpret complex, difficult, or sensitive information.
6. Mainframe security support, maintenance, and monitoring of z/OS systems including RACF and critical company applications.
7. Design, create, delete, modify, and verify RACF security groups, user accounts, resource/data set profiles, certificates, keyrings, and permissions using zSecure and native RACF commands.
8. Support and comply with internal/external audit requests, ServiceNow requests, and IAM Access Requests.
9. Perform analysis, design, documentation, testing, implementation, and on-going support for the infrastructure mainframe security environment.
10. Maintain high quality and consistency for security settings, rules, and procedures.
11. Provide recommendations for the security settings of mainframe software products and features.
12. Provide input and follow-through for continuous improvement to mainframe security.
13. Learn to configure zSecure, develop reporting, and improve automation using REXX, SQL, SAS, and CARLa.
14. Participate in team on-call coverage rotation, which includes tactical security administration and provide support on weekends. Participant in disaster recovery tests (on weekends), audits and penetration testing. Provide 24/7 support for Truist operations.
15. Lead small cybersecurity projects with manageable risks and resource requirements; plays significant roles in larger, more complex initiatives.
Keywords: Cyber Security, RACF, Racf Mainframe, mainframe, RSA

Job Description:
Identity and Access Management:Designing and implementing AWS IAM policies, roles, and access controls to manage user identities and permissions effectively.
Policy Development:Developing and maintaining AWS IAM policies that specify who has access to which AWS resources, following the principle of least privilege.
Access Reviews:Regularly reviewing and auditing user access permissions to ensure they align with security policies and compliance requirements.
Security Best Practices:Staying up-to-date with AWS security best practices and ensuring IAM policies are in line with these practices.
Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA):Implementing and managing MFA to enhance user authentication and security.
Federated Identity:Configuring and managing federated identity systems to allow single sign-on (SSO) for AWS services.
Compliance and Regulations:Ensuring AWS IAM practices comply with relevant regulations and industry-specific standards.
Security Assessment:Conducting security assessments and reviews to identify potential vulnerabilities and threats related to IAM and access controls.
Incident Response:Developing incident response plans related to unauthorized access or security breaches and assisting in resolving security incidents when they occur.
Keywords: Access management, Security Analyst, AWS

Job Description:
Job Title: Security Analyst/Senior Security Analyst - Risk Management

Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Security Analyst Risk Management to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in information security risk management and possess exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills. As a Risk Management Analyst, you will be responsible for assessing and managing risks across our organization, developing risk mitigation strategies, and providing guidance to stakeholders on risk-related matters. You will also collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that risk management processes and controls are effectively implemented.

Responsibilities:
Conduct thorough information security risk assessments and identify potential risks across various departments and processes within the organization.
Analyze risk data and develop risk mitigation strategies to minimize potential impact on the organization's objectives and operations.
Collaborate with key stakeholders to develop risk management plans and procedures, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives.
Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of information security risk controls and recommend improvements as necessary.
Provide guidance and support to business units in implementing risk management practices and procedures.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and regulatory requirements related to risk management.
Prepare and present risk reports and findings to management and other stakeholders.
Participate in cross-functional teams to identify and address risks associated with new projects, initiatives, and changes in business processes.
Foster a culture of risk awareness and compliance throughout the organization by conducting trainings and workshops as needed.

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or a related field. Advanced degree or relevant professional certifications (such as CISA, CRISC) are a plus.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in information security risk management or related roles, preferably in a corporate environment.
Solid understanding of risk management principles, methodologies, and best practices.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret and analyze complex data.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate risk-related information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and influence decision-making processes.
Proficient in using risk management tools, software, and techniques.
Familiarity with regulatory frameworks and requirements related to risk management (e.g. NIST, FAIR etc.)
Attention to detail and ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously.
Keywords: Risk Management, Information Risk Management, Cisa, Information Security, NIST, security risk management, CRISC, communication skills

Job Description:
This Business Information Analyst role will support Unilever s BISO for North Asia, South Asia, and South East Asia. The role will include supporting in cyber analysis and reporting across the region, and support in some risk management activities as well. These activities will be conducted with a Risk Based approach to help individual businesses manage cyber risk in their area.
Role Summary:
A vacancy exists for Business Information Analyst for North Asia, South Asia, and South East Asia within Unilever s cyber function. The successful candidate will support Unilever s cyber function in the region in achieving and maintaining Cyber Security objectives, standards, awareness, and compliance, defined using a Risk Based approach through timely and actionable report creation and socialisation. This role will partner with the BISO for Acquired Businesses to support in delivering services to the Acquired Businesses in the region. This analyst position will report to the regional Business Information Security Officer.
Key areas delivered by the BISO team that will be supported by this role s reporting will include:
Cyber security solution engineering and risk advisory across Unilever business in region of responsibility, assuring appropriate risk identification, assessment, mitigation, and reporting.
Ensuring the deployment and running of security tooling in the regions, in conjunction with the Security Tech & Ops team.
Ensuring the Security Operations Centers (SOC) have full visibility across the ecosystem and actively participate in incident response at the direction of the Head of Incident Response.
Developing and delivering risk reports to the region.
Tailoring cyber training and awareness across the region in alignment and partnership with the Cyber Training and Awareness Lead.
Leading cyber cultural transformation across the region in line with our Security Strategy and Transformation program.
Maintaining and effectively directing the timely closure of security exceptions in businesses while reporting status to the Governance, Risk, Assurance and Compliance (GRAC) team.
Providing standards and controls feedback, based on local implementation requirements to the GRAC team to help shape global policies and standards.
Partnering with the BISO for Acquired Businesses to ensure appropriate cyber risk mitigation is ongoing for acquired businesses in their regions of responsibility.
Partner with the BISO for Supply Chain and ISO for R&D to ensure appropriate cyber risk mitigation for those functional areas within his/her region of responsibility.
Testing resiliency (including business continuity planning (BCP) and disaster recovery (DR)) in the region of responsibility.
Main Accountabilities
Responsible for supporting the BISO in data gathering, report creation, and presentation for the region.
Responsible for supporting the BISO in cyber risk reporting across the region to the CISO and to the regional business leaders.
Key Skills and Relevant Experience
Skills:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and able to be understood by both technical and non-technical personnel.
Proven ability to lead, develop, and motivate a team.
Ability to manage conflicting priorities and multiple tasks.
Skilled with Excel, Power BI, and PowerPoint.
Strong data management and analysis skills
Stakeholder management and interpersonal skills at both a technical and non-technical level.
Ability to work in a collaborative environment with international team members.
Outstanding critical reasoning and problem-solving skills - sticking to the problem until it is resolved.
Customer-orientated, whether responding to queries or delivering new services.
While Unilever s primary language is English, business language proficiency in additional regional languages is preferred.
Experience:
The role holder will have ideally have previously held a role in Cyber Security or have a passion to learn more in the area.
Experience driving a complex change agenda, and an ability to challenge the status quo .
Strong strategic and operational business awareness, with an understanding of the key drivers, levers, issues, and constraints of digital businesses.
Experience within a customer focused environment.
Behaviours
Candidates would be required to demonstrate the Unilever Standards of Leadership & live the Values through showing the following behaviors:
Agility - Flexes leadership style and plans to meet changing situations with urgency. Learns from the past, envisions the future, has a healthy dissatisfaction with the status quo.
Personal Mastery - Actively builds wellbeing and resilience in themselves and their team. Has emotional intelligence to take feedback, manage mood and motivations, and build empathy for others. Sets high standards for themselves and always brings their best self.
Passion for High Performance - Inspires the energy needed to win, generating intensity and focus to motivate people to deliver results at speed.
Keywords: Supply chain, Data management, ISO, Information security, Disaster recovery, Business continuity planning, Risk management, Security operations, Operations, Business operations

Job Description:
About Norwin Technologies:

Norwin Technologies is a 20-year-old US Based Information Technology Consulting and Services company that helps clients deliver technology and operational excellence across the entire digital spectrum specializing in IT Infrastructure. Norwin is part of the Accscient group, which has a portfolio of 17 technology companies.We are a Great Place to Work certified organization, dedicated to attracting, engaging, and retaining talent through a culture that nurtures success, encourages communication, and accelerates careers.We work with some of the leading brands in the technology industry, partnering with them to deliver IT infrastructure projects ranging from technology cover design/architecture, remote deployment, migrations, upgrade, to operations of technologies both in Data Centers and Cloud.

Job description:

Job Title: Cyber Security Principal Consultant

Years of Experience: 15+ Years
Work Location: Bangalore

You will:

Contribute to the development of client Cyber security strategies, policies, and best practices by leading consulting engagements, planning sessions and design meetings.
Serve as a project lead, driving high quality delivery experiences for customers, including creating and delivering actionable written documentation and compelling oral presentations.
Lead comprehensive assessments to identify existing security programs, vulnerabilities and emerging attack vectors covering infrastructure, cloud, resiliency, data, devices, applications, and user access management.
Understand customers strategic goals, business, and technology challenges quickly and guide customers to adopt modern effective security solutions.
Assist organizations in establishing near-term goals with business-oriented, prioritized milestones tailored for their cyber security programs. Factoring in people, process and technology aligned to NIST Frameworks, CIS Controls, and global standards.
Work with a broad spectrum of customer stakeholders that own shared Cyber security responsibilities such as governance, risk and compliance, security, application, infrastructure, engineering, operations to facilitate alignment on common goals and actionable security road maps.
.
Heres what we are looking for with this role:

15+ years of professional experience in customer facing IT roles with at least a bachelors degree or commensurate experience.
Extraordinary communication skills.

5+ years of experience performing security risk assessments and security architecture reviews, while providing guidance across all Cyber security stakeholders.
Must have experience with at least one (1) and be familiar with at least two (2) of the following: PCI DSS, NIST CSF/RMF, CMMC, C2M2, HIPAA, CIS 18.

Job Description:
Detect, identify, and analyze vulnerabilities across FICO environment.
Assess the risk of vulnerabilities detected to determine true impact.
Support stakeholders as a SME to understand technical details of vulnerabilities and steps to carry out remediation.
Coordinate with stakeholders to track issues remediation until closure.
Act as a SME for new projects in terms of vulnerability management lifecycle.
Manage, maintain, and tune tools used to support the VM process.
Update yourself with the latest security and technology developments.
What We re Seeking
Experience in a similar role such as vulnerability management specialist.
Experience with Qualys or other security vulnerability detection technology required.
Demonstrates subject-matter expert level understanding in multiple IT, Security and Software disciplines.
Ability to understand the cause and effect of application vulnerabilities with Operating System Vulnerabilities.
Must be able to multi-task and keep track of large amounts of information across disparate systems.
Ability to keep making progress and define future strategy/policy with regards to Enterprise CVA.
Adherent to continuous monitoring and continuous improvement thought process.
Demonstrated technical security expertise in a variety of cloud platforms (AWS is preferred).
Comfortable interfacing with other internal or external organizations regarding problems that must be addressed to enhance security posture.
Ability to effectively translate and present solutions in business or management terms.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Knowledge of Python scripting language is preferred.
Moderate documentation and analytical skills; documenting processes, policies, and standards.
Moderate ability to provide end to end support to enterprise counterparts, identifying root cause of complex enterprise initiatives.
Moderate trouble shooting skills across complex enterprise applications, server, and endpoint environments.
Moderate ability to onboard, learn and adapt to new technologies.
Basic privileged access management/right management experience, designing solutions based on least privilege.
Basic knowledge of malware operation, indicators or threat.
Moderate knowledge of current threat landscape.
Our Offer to You
A culture and work environment strongly reflecting our core values: Act like an Owner, Delight Our Customers and Earn the Respect of Others.
The opportunity to make a difference by leveraging your unique strengths.
Highly competitive compensation and rewards.
Flexible work options, opportunities to give back to your community, social events with colleagues and a comprehensive benefits program inclusive of progressive parental leave.
Keywords: Access management, Enterprise applications, Machine learning, Anti money laundering, Vulnerability, Vulnerability management, Continuous improvement, Analytics, Monitoring, FICO

Job Description:
The Cyber Security Analyst is a member of the Security Operations Center responsible for the protection of Availity s online and corporate systems.
This role is member of Availity s security incident response team (SIRT) that performs incident and forensic investigations across all of Availity s companies.
This role participates in a 24x7x365 work effort and in such will be required at times to work after hours and participate in an on-call rotation.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Monitor information security alerts from firewalls, IDS, OS, Anti-Virus, servers, and other security tools through the use of a SIEM.
Level 1 analysis of intrusions to network, application, and infrastructure related devices.
Detect and document anomalies identified on the network.
Participate as a member of the incident response team.
Maintain or assist in the maintenance of the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all data in physical and/or electronic format.
Support cyber security initiatives through both predictive and reactive analysis.
Required Skills SOC Analyst, SIEM
Keywords: cyber security analyst, cyber security, Networking, Information security, SIEM, Antivirus, Forensic investigations, SOC Analyst, Security operations

Job Description:
Roles and Responsibilities

**Job Description:** We are looking for a Security Analyst to work on protection of different Brands under management with SLP. The primary focus will be to support and manage Current Brand Monitoring platform utilizing open-Source tool for enrichment of Brand related alerts. Identify correlations with existing incidents, completing impact analysis for alerts and proving solutions for closure. Join us as a Security Analyst at SLP, where you'll play a crucial role in protecting our diverse portfolio of brands. Your primary focus will be to manage our "Current Brand Monitoring platform" using open-source tools to enhance brand-related alerts. You'll be responsible for identifying correlations with existing incidents, conducting impact analysis, and providing effective solutions.

**Required Skills:**
1. Hands-on experience with security tools such as Virus Total, Cuckoo, OTX, Threatconnect, Hybrid Analysis, IBM Xforce, Whoisdomain tools, MXtoolbox, Zscaler (Zulu), CSI ForcePoint, CheckPhish, Any.run, Mitaka.
2. Expertise in developing correlations using open-source platforms like CERT Bodies (US-CERT, CERT-IN, Australia-CERT), Thehackernews, Bleeping Computers, Securelist (Kaspersky).
3. Understanding of firewalls, proxies, SIEM, antivirus, and IDPS concepts.
4. Basic knowledge of programming languages like Java or C.

**Responsibilities and Duties:**
1. Monitor and analyze alerts for issues related to typo-squatting, fake domains, fake mobile applications, fake websites, and fake social media content/profiles.
2. Fine-tune platform configuration and incorporate input from Monitoring and Analysis teams. - Create standard operating procedures for incident handling.
3. Report critical incidents and metrics. - Correlate alerts with 3rd party/open-source tools for deeper insights. - Conduct incident response and forensics.
4. Initiate takedowns of malicious websites and social media profiles.

**Requirements:** -
BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience in information security or a related field.
Hands-on programming experience with Java and Python.
Familiarity with cloud concepts; knowledge of AWS/Azure is a plus.


**Preferred Organizations:** Candidates with experience in SLP and E-Commerce environments are encouraged to apply. If you're ready to make a difference and protect brands in the digital world, please share your updated CV with us at Nisha.Mohite@ril.com.
Keywords: Security, Cyber Security, Network Security, networking, Gcp Cloud, Firewall, cloud, otx, Proxy, Azure Cloud, Network, Thehackernews, SIEM, AWS, Security Operations, Security Services

Job Description:
Company Name: Keyloop

Experience range: 2-5 years

Title: Cyber Security Engineer
(We are not looking for Analyst, this role is specifically for Cyber Security Engineer)

Job location: Hyderabad (Hitec City)

Role overview:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Cyber Security Engineer to join the Security Operations
team at Keyloop. As a Cyber Security Engineer, you will play a critical role in improving the maturity of our security toolset, integrating various security tools, and ensuring comprehensive coverage to protect our organization from evolving cyber threats. Your expertise and innovative approach will be
instrumental in enhancing our security posture and safeguarding our valuable assets.

Key Responsibilities:
Evaluate our existing security toolset and identify areas for improvement to enhance our cyber defense capabilities. 
Propose and implement upgrades or new tools as necessary to strengthen our security
infrastructure.
Lead the effort to integrate different security tools and platforms to ensure seamless
collaboration and centralized management. Work with various teams to ensure tools
complement each other and are cohesive.
Conduct thorough assessments of our security tool coverage to identify any gaps or redundancies. Implement measures to ensure all critical areas are adequately protected, minimizing potential blind spots.
Optimize vulnerability management processes, leveraging various scanning and reporting tools to detect, prioritize, and remediate vulnerabilities effectively.
Assist in developing and refining incident response playbooks. Ensure that security tools are appropriately configured to provide early detection and response to security incidents.
Implement robust monitoring and reporting mechanisms for security tools to ensure visibility into systems.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of security policies and procedures, ensuring alignment with industry standards and best practices.

People Attributes:
You will already have Security Engineering experience and have at least 3-5 years of Information Security experience.
You demonstrate strong analytical skills and a genuine passion for cyber security, constantly seeking opportunities to learn and stay up-to-date with the evolving threat landscape.
Excellent communication skills are vital, enabling you to convey complex security concepts and controls effectively to business stakeholders and end-users.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, Networks, and Compliance, to ensure a unified approach to cyber security and effective communication of security-related matters.
You are solution-driven and continuously strive for process improvement and security optimization.
A positive, proactive attitude, coupled with a sense of responsibility and accountability, characterizes your approach to your work.

Technical Attributes:
ÃÂ Working knowledge of security tooling is essential, including SIEMs, SOAR, DLP, EDR, Anti-Virus,
Vulnerability Scanners, IDS/IPS.
ÃÂ Strong knowledge of Information Security frameworks, standards, and methodologies.
ÃÂ You understand business and Information Security risk and can prioritize incidents based on
their potential impact on the organization.
ÃÂ Clear and concise reporting and technical writing skills to facilitate effective communication of
security findings and recommendations.
Education/Qualifications:
ÃÂ While no specific qualifications are required for this role, technical and/or cloud based
certifications would be advantageous.
Note: This job specification is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by
employees in this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills
required. Other duties may be assigned as needed to meet the organization's goals and objectives.
Keywords: Cyber Security, Antivirus, Vulnerability Scanning, SIEM, IPSEC, Information Security, Dlp, Soar, Zscaler, Edr, Crowdstrike, IDS, Splunk, AWS
