Job Description:
The Information Security Analyst is responsible for supporting the execution of the Information Security strategy
The Information Security Analyst provides data and analysis to measure the effectiveness of Information Security controls across group wide products and services
The Information Security Analyst identifies and evaluates potential areas of Information Security threats by assessing the probability and impact, and facilitates feedback for mitigation
Roles within Information Security may cover one or more areas of speciality, eg
Identity & Access Management (which may include, for example, authentication; access management & control; recertification etc); Information Security ( IS ) Operations (which may for example include, cyber threat operations; cyber forensics, protection against data leakage etc) and IS Technology (which may include IS architecture, IS engineering, cryptographic services etc
Overview:
The DWS CSO I&A function designs, build, and operate strategic solutions for managing the request, approval, provision, revocation of privileged access and its recertification to ensure DWS stays compliant with internal and external controls and regulations.
We are in the process of building a IAM (Identity & Access Management solution) based on Forgerock and PAM (Privileged Access Management) solution based on CyberArk Technology in the Cloud.
What we ll offer you
As part of our flexible scheme, here are just some of the benefits that you ll enjoy
Best in class leave policy
Gender neutral parental leaves
100% reimbursement under childcare assistance benefit (gender neutral)
Sponsorship for Industry relevant certifications and education
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family members
Comprehensive Hospitalization Insurance for you and your dependents
Accident and Term life Insurance
Complementary Health screening for 35 yrs. and above
Your key responsibilities:
Execute Manual ID admin requests
Support all IAM or PAM related governance processes, e. g. operational run of Campaign recertifications, Detective SoD, On-boarding of accounts and applications
Execute compensating controls where IT implementation is not yet ready
Understand and define requirements and business processes
Support the Access Lifecycle processes for the strategic solution as well as compensating controls for tactical solutions
Understand and proactively manage operational, regulatory, and other risks related to the service
Support maintenance of IAM and PAM information assets across the organisation, including documentation, catalogues and risk assessments
Support UAT and Functional Testing of the IAM solution

Your skills and experience:
Knowledge of IAM and PAM processes and solutions
1 to 2 years of experience in Information Security, specifically Identity and Privileged Access Management
Understand the large scale thinking and approach of a global service
Proven experience in an ID administration role
Proven experience in an IAM Business Analyst role
Attention to detail and able to deliver high quality material to agreed timeframes
Good understanding of Information Security Control frameworks
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong relationship management and communication skills
Knowledge of the financial services industry and its compliance issues is a plus
How we ll support you
Training and development to help you excel in your career
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
Keywords: Relationship management, Information Security Analyst, Access management, Information security, Analytical, Functional testing, Banking, Training and Development, Operations, Financial services

Job Description:
All employees have a responsibility to co-operate in promoting and maintaining a safe and healthy working environment, and to take reasonable care of their own health and safety at work and that of all other staff that may be affected by their acts or omissions. Line managers have specific responsibility for the health and safety of their direct reports and other team members for which they have general management responsibility.
All employees are also responsible for supporting and implementing the company s policies and procedures around the Health and Safety, Security, Quality and Business Continuity arrangements that apply in their role/work function. Full details of these policies and procedures are available on SharePoint.
Conduct thorough investigations into security risks and incidents in APAC countries for clients, working with internal staff, systems and data, as well as third parties to assemble the required information.
To run and investigate client cases in APAC in conjunction with the global security teams as necessary, and report and document the outcome of such investigation in global share point.
Identify areas of opportunities and take initiatives to improve process efficiency.
Ensure that security standards are maintained and that security objectives are being met or exceeded.
Be an expert and spokesperson to all internal parties, to raise internal awareness and mindshare of the quality message.
Proactively own the effective resolution of security issues
Develop, maintain and communicate efficient security processes to relevant parties.
Work under minimum supervision and act as an escalation point for global project and channel quality to resolve issues.
Proactively work on improving the security control via new internal processes as well as new external security awareness measures.
Highlight any additional opportunities and possible quality, security or Health & Safety trouble areas to the reporting manager.
Key Activities
Investigating client security incidents and risks in APAC, and proactively own their resolution.
As required, recommend and implement corrective actions in APAC such as re-training, suspension or termination of testing centres.
Make recommendations for technology and process improvements to support security policies and initiatives.
Monitor the APAC channel for client security risks by utilising existing reports/creating new reports/ to investigate new security trends.
Managing the systematic risk profiling of APAC countries for client testing.
Work on various global security projects to monitor security standards at testing centres through video monitoring, eye glass inspection, remote surveillance etc
Extensive use of data analytics for investigating flagged test centres and candidates as per defined process and reporting key observations to the reporting manager.
Run various VSS reports and conduct investigations in APAC as appropriate, including collaboration with global security teams.
Investigating Pearson testing channel in APAC by Identifying and preventing exam fraud & infringement through review of candidate biometrics and other data points
Closely work with manager in supporting new global projects/initiatives including data forensics.
Maintain accurate documentation of client/site investigations with evidences using the Global Security Sharepoint system.
Web Monitoring-Review websites, twitters, you-tubes, forums and other social media platform flagged for suspicious content/activity for key PVUE client as per predefined criteria and tag them for client action as applicable.
Co-ordinate with stake holders to ensure timely action on sceptical web-links
Closely monitor target achievement and budgetary expenses.
Generate weekly, monthly and quarterly reports indicating individual performance.
Run Integrity shop reports to monitor the testing centre performance and implement corrective actions if necessary.
Provide input for the Channel newsletter.
Work with global channel security/quality for implementing various process improvements.

Job Description:
The team delivers security solutions and services across a range of technology domains including cloud, web, endpoint, network and more, The cyber security team is looking for an individual with a passion for web application security and applying hands-on skills, using web inspection tools and technical expertise to investigate, test and assess web security issues, solve problems and recommend remediation measures in a modern enterprise security program worthy of Keysight.
Candidates should have a strong interest in cyber security, and a solid grasp of web technologies such as HTTP, TLS, JavaScript, SAML2 and proxy servers. An analytical approach to problems using data and critical thinking will be essential. Interest in hacking will be a plus. A successful candidate will become a member of the Information Security and Compliance team and will work with web developers, application owners and users to implement security controls, identify weaknesses, adopt best practices.
This will include producing and analyzing vulnerability reports, as well as manually reproducing, demonstrating and explaining the findings. Collaboration on projects with the rest of the security team and with engineers from other departments will be frequent.
Desired Skills and Experience :
Strong understanding of DNS, TCP, HTTP and related security issues, Ability to review and understand HTML and Javascript code, Understanding of common web application protocols (XML, JSON, SAML2, WSGI), Understanding of web servers and reverse proxies, such as Apache, Nginx and Tomcat, Experience with web application security scanners, such as Net Sparker and Burp Suite, Understanding of public keys, certificates, and authentication concepts, Understanding of application security issues such as the OWASP Top 10,
Keywords: TCP, Tomcat, XML, Information security, Javascript, DNS, HTML, HTTP, JSON, Apache

Job Description:
The candidate should have a team-oriented, client-facing mindset with proven experience conducting EDR infrastructure deployments. Use deep insights to identify, recommend and execute resolution for malware and other EDR-detected incidents while helping to develop and execute methodologies for EDR deployment, feature enablement and technical integration in a SOC.
As an Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) SME, candidate will play a key role in supporting the design, deployment, configuration, optimization, and operation of a large-scale Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) deployment solution or similar security products, across multiple geographies.
Candidate shall be responsible for managing day to day operations of Security Device Management SIEM, incident response, threat hunting, Use case engineering, SOC analyst, device integration with SIEM. Also Responsible for identifying, reporting and tracking system vulnerabilities within corporate, commercial and federal assets ensuring the integrity of the environment
Qualifications
Experience in a cybersecurity role in a large size enterprise
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Experience with deployment of an EDR solution in a large customer environment, including 15k+ endpoints
Knowledge of intrusion detection methodologies and techniques for detecting host and network- based intrusions
Experience with providing status reports, including metrics and KPIs, for team activities
Knowledge of network security architecture concepts including topology, protocols, components, and principles
Knowledge of various enterprise operating system (OS) configurations and management tools for use during deployment, configuration, and management of EDR solutions
3+ years of experience with deployment, configuration, or maintenance of supporting enterprise EDR solutions, including Carbon Black EDR, CrowdStrike Falcon (is a plus), SentinelOne, FireEye HX, McAfee, Tanium, etc.
3+ years of experience with performing systems administration, including basic troubleshooting and installation, monitoring system performance or availability, performing security upgrades, and optimizing solution configurations to meet the needs of operational users
3+ years of experience in EDR and/or AV; previous work in malware and attack analysis, research, investigation, and response role by performing forensic analysis of logs and packet captures to identify malicious artifacts
2+ years of experience in working with a Security Operations Center (SOC) environment, leveraging EDR tools to support incident response, vulnerability scanning, threat hunting, network monitoring and log management, and compliance management activities
+3 years of experience with a solid understanding of the TCP/IP protocol suite, security
architecture, and common TTP s (tactics, techniques, and procedures) used by threat actors
Experience in performing and analyzing both log and packet data to perform incident response in a SIEM environment (Splunk, NetWitness, Azure Sentinel, etc.) and identify potential compromises to customer networks.
Knowledge of federal information security policies, standards, procedures, directives, frameworks, federal security authorizations, assessment, and risk management processes for enterprise systems
Strong verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills are required to document and communicate findings, escalate critical incidents, and interact with customers
Experience using ticketing systems for tracking (WebHelpDesk, Remedy, OpsConsole, ServiceNow, etc.)
Candidate must possess, at least one, applicable professional/technical certifications, such as Security +, C|EH, OSCP, GCIH, CISSP, GPEN, GWAPT, GISEC, CISM, CrowdStrike Certified Falcon Hunter, Responder, Administrator, or CISA
Experience in Automation orchestration technologies: such as SOAR, Ansible, Puppet, Chef
Experience in Coding languages: such as Python, PowerShell, Perl, C/C++, Java, etc.
Unix/Linux RedHat windows Administration
Skills Required
Project and delivery management experience 3+ years EDR administration (CrowdStrike Falcon, VMware Carbon Black, Palo Alto Network Cortex XDR, Microsoft Windows Defender, Cylance, Tanium etc.)
3 + years of working with EDR tools performing requirements gathering, deployment, configuration, and conducting threat hunting
5+ years working with operational information security disciplines (e.g. incident response, security infrastructure management, or monitoring services)
3+ years security tool engineering and administration (e.g. NGAV, EPP, EDR, SIEM, SOAR, UEBA, Deception, Attack Surface Management, etc.)
Some of the following EDR experience- Agent deployment, health check and coverage sustainability
- Threat Hunting
- Systems integration
- Comparing vendor functionality
- Mapping EDR capabilities to threat scenarios
- Deploying EDR in a multi-agent (i.e. AV, NG AV) environments
- Deep understanding and proven experience in Cybersecurity Operations (Monitoring, Detection, Incident Response, Forensics)
Personal skills:
Good Team player
Possess Positive and learning attitude
Good Verbal and Written communication skills
Sense of Ownership, Priorities and Autonomous
Ability to travel up to 50% of the time
Roles & Responsibilities
  As an Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) Tools Engineer, the candidate will be part of the Cyber security team responsible for deploying, operating, and maintaining the global EDR platform. The candidate will provide support for EDR tools in the environment. The candidate must be able to communicate with the Security Operations and Incident Response teams to identify adjustments and modifications to be made to the EDR toolset. As in the most senior EDR tools engineer position, the candidate must be able to lead and by example to drive progress forward.

work with cross functional teams to identify the right mix of processes and technology to implement solutions to support the needs of the internal and external customers.

Work to integrate cybersecurity data using enterprise or custom tools data aggregation and analysis tools, including Splunk and similar complementary security solutions.
Manage projects to completion both individually and in a group as well as mentoring others and orchestrating team efforts for problem solving

Provide content on deliverables, including written reports and technical documents, SOPs and configuration guides, and training and briefing materials
Collaborate and consult with peers, colleagues, and managers, etc. to resolve issues and achieve goals
General SIEM monitoring, analysis, content development, and maintenance.
Daily security activities related to the protection of corporate and other federal assets including scanning tools and ticketing systems documenting the identification and remediation process for identified system flaws
Provide information to system owners of flaws identified within that groups responsible systems.
Assist in risk assessment duties including reporting and oversight of remediation efforts
Research, analysis, and response for alerts; including log retrieval and documentation.
Conduct analysis of network traffic and host activity across a wide array of technologies and platforms.
Assist in incident response activities such as host triage and retrieval, malware analysis, remote system analysis, end-user interviews, and remediation efforts.
Enterprise-level experience managing the remediation of vulnerabilities in two or more of the following areas:
Server Operating Systems (Windows Server, Red Hat, CentOS)
Network (Cisco, Fortinet, Palo Alto, F5, McAfee)
Storage (NetApp, CleverSafe)
Manage multiple projects with various priority levels and time lines from start to finish
Develop and maintain accurate documentation for internal procedures and services
Maintain knowledge of outstanding vulnerability management issues and ensure remediation timelines are completed by required guidelines
Thorough understanding of how to calculate CVSS v2 and v3 adjusted scores
Must collaborate with other departments to resolve complex issues and be detail oriented

Job Description:
The IT Security Analyst performs two core functions for the enterprise
The first is the day-to-day operations of the in-place security solutions while the second is the identification, investigation, and resolution of security breaches detected by those systems
Secondary tasks may include involvement in the implementation of new security solutions, participation in the creation and or maintenance of policies, standards, baselines, guidelines, and procedures as well as conducting vulnerability audits and assessments
The IT Security Analyst is expected to be fully aware of the enterprise s security goals as established by its stated policies, procedures, and guidelines and to actively work towards upholding those goals
What you will do:
Strategy Planning
Participate in the planning and design of enterprise security architecture, under the direction of the Director, IT Governance Risk and Compliance, where appropriate.
Participate in the creation of enterprise security documents (policies, standards, baselines, guidelines, and procedures) under the direction of the Director, IT Governance Risk and Compliance, where appropriate.
Participate in the planning and design of enterprise/divisional business continuity plans and disaster recovery plans, under the direction of the Director, IT Governance Risk and Compliance, where appropriate.
Acquisition Deployment
Maintain up-to-date detailed knowledge of the IT security industry including awareness of new or revised security solutions, improved security processes, and the development of new attacks and threat vectors
Recommend additional security solutions or enhancements to existing security solutions to improve overall enterprise security
Perform or participate in the deployment, integration, and initial configuration of all new security solutions and of any enhancements to existing security solutions in accordance with company project management methodologies and standard procedures
Operational Management
Monitor all in-place security solutions for efficient and appropriate operations.
Review logs and reports of all in-place devices, whether they be under direct control (ie security tools) or not (eg workstations, servers, network devices). Interpret the implications of that activity and devise plans for appropriate resolution.
Participate in investigations into problematic activity in compliance with the company policies. Interpret activity, investigate and make recommendations for resolution. Work with the Security Operations
Centre and the other IT groups on incident investigations.
Maintain up-to-date baselines for the secure configuration and operations of all in-place devices, whether they be under direct control (ie security tools) or not (eg workstations, servers, network devices, cloud assets).
Maintain operational configurations of all in-place security solutions as per the established baselines.
Participate in and provide information as requested for security compliance reviews and information security audits (internal, external or customer audits).
Participate in the design and execution of vulnerability assessments, penetration tests, and security audits.
Provide support for divisional IT and other IT groups for all in-place security solutions.
What you will need:
Formal Education Certification
Bachelor degree or post-secondary technology diploma in Computer Science or related field and two years of relevant work experience.
One or more of the following certifications:
o ISC2 Certifications: SSCP, CCSP, CISSP
o ISACA Certifications: CISA, CISM
o Microsoft Certified Security: Engineer, Administrator or similar
o CompTIA Security+
Knowledge of information security frameworks and relevant regulations, such as ISO 27001, NIST, PCI, GDPR.
Knowledge of project management concepts and project work experience is desirable.
Knowledge Experience
Extensive experience with LogRhythm SIEM or other SIEM platforms, Tenable or Qualys vulnerability management, web application scanning, Mimecast or other email security solutions, Microsoft 365 security solutions, SCCM, Intune, Azure AD, anti-malware solutions.
Experience with firewall technologies, IDS/IPS, VPN, TLS, networking, wireless networking, cryptography, authentication protocols, zero trust network access (ZTNA), Zscaler or equivalent solutions.
Working / technical knowledge of disaster recovery planning, data protection, network penetration testing, software patching, web applications
Strong understanding of IP, TCP/IP, cloud technologies, Azure, network administration protocols, Microsoft operating systems.
Familiarity with: PowerShell, SQL databases, SOAR, secure coding tools Veracode, SecOps, risk management.
Personal Attributes
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Good written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
Ability to investigate IT security incidents, root cause analysis and events correlation.
Ability to present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language.
Highly self-motivated and directed.
Keen attention to detail.
Team-oriented and skilled in working within a collaborative environment
Keywords: Automation, Network administration, Coding, VPN, Project management, Information security, Deployment, microsoft, SQL, Firewall

Minimum Work Experience: At least 6 months of research experience in IT/CS/Cybersecurity.
Maximum Work Experience: Not more than 3 years of research experience in IT/CS/Cybersecurity.
Candidate Residency: Mumbai or Mumbai Suburban only.
Work Location: Onsite, Work from Office.
Joining: Immediate availability preferred.

Section 2: Preferred Technical Skills
Research Skills: Strong research capabilities with a focus on Cybersecurity, IT and computer science topics.
Technical Expertise: In-depth knowledge of web product development technologies and practices.
Programming Languages: Proficiency in languages such as Python, Java, C++, or similar.
Research Methodologies: Experience in conducting research, experiments, and data analysis.
Problem Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Innovation: Ability to generate innovative ideas and solutions.
Collaboration: Effective teamwork and communication skills.
Publication: Track record of publishing research findings in relevant journals or conferences.

Large organization experience (Big4, MNC, Banks, etc), Government Agency or Armed Forces experience is good to have but not mandatory

Section 3: Role & Responsibilities
Research and Development: A. Conduct in-depth research in the field of Cybersecurity, IT and computer science. B. Propose and explore innovative solutions to technical challenges. C. Collaborate with the Technical R&D Team to drive product development through research-backed insights.
Technical Analysis: A. Analyze technical trends, emerging technologies, and industry developments. B. Evaluate the feasibility and potential impact of adopting new technologies. C. Provide technical recommendations to support decision-making.
Experimentation and Prototyping: A. Plan and execute experiments and prototypes to validate research hypotheses. B. Develop proof-of-concept models and technology demonstrators. C. Document research findings and insights.
Product Enhancement: A. Work closely with the product development team to translate research findings into practical product features. B. Assist in the optimization and improvement of web product development processes.
Collaboration and Communication: A. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and product managers. B. Communicate research findings and insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Publication and Knowledge Sharing: A. Prepare and publish research papers or articles in relevant journals and conferences. B. Share knowledge and insights through internal and external channels.
Ad Hoc Responsibilities: Assist in any ad-hoc research projects and tasks as directed by senior management and leadership.

Section 4: Perks and benefits Eligible and well performing Employees may be offered the following as per Organization Policy, as applicable to the respective Employee: Allowances, Reimbursements, Medical, Bonuses, Gratuity, Item Purchase Discounts, Internal Hiring Preference, Employer Financed Training/Certification, On-the-Job Training, Employer Recognition, Accelerated Promotions, Pro-Bono Services, Pantry Access, Travel & Accommodation Discounts, Retirement Packages, Exchangeable Leaves, etc
Keywords: Cyber Security, Research And Development, Incident Response, Digital Forensics, Security Operations Center, Security Analysis, Information Security, Vulnerability Assessment, Malware Analysis, IT Risk Management, Cyber Forensics, Log Analysis, Penetration Testing, IT Security

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Information Security Analyst to join our team at DPDzero
As the Information Security Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and implementing robust information security strategies, policies, and practices, with a primary focus on aligning with the ISO 27001 framework
You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to identify and mitigate security risks, lead security assessments and audits, and ensure compliance with ISO 27001, along with other industry standards and regulatory requirements
Your expertise in ISO 27001, information security, risk management, and security best practices will be critical in maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of our systems and data
Responsibilities:
Information Security Strategy: Develop and implement the company s information security strategy and roadmap, with a strong emphasis on aligning with ISO 27001, while also aligning it with business goals and objectives.
Security Governance: Establish and maintain an effective information security governance framework based on ISO 27001, including policies, procedures, and standards.
Risk Management: Identify, assess, and prioritize information security risks following ISO 27001 guidelines, and develop risk mitigation plans and controls.
Security Awareness: Foster a culture of security awareness among employees, partners, and stakeholders through training and communication initiatives, in line with ISO 27001 requirements.
Incident Response: Develop and execute ISO 27001 compliant incident response plans to address and mitigate security incidents and breaches.
Security Compliance: Ensure compliance with ISO 27001 and other relevant security standards, frameworks, and regulatory requirements.
Security Assessments: Conduct regular security assessments, vulnerability assessments, and penetration tests, adhering to ISO 27001 principles, to identify and address security vulnerabilities.
Security Audits: Coordinate and participate in security audits and assessments, particularly focusing on ISO 27001 compliance, to evaluate the effectiveness of security controls.
Security Monitoring: Implement and manage security monitoring tools and systems in line with ISO 27001 requirements to detect and respond to security threats in real-time.
Security Training: Provide training and guidance to the IT and security teams to enhance their knowledge and skills in information security, with ISO 27001 as a key reference.
Third-Party Risk Management: Evaluate and manage security risks associated with third-party vendors and service providers, with ISO 27001 compliance as a priority.
Incident Reporting: Prepare and present security incident reports to senior management and stakeholders, following ISO 27001 reporting guidelines.
Security Performance Metrics: Define and track key security performance metrics and KPIs, including those outlined in ISO 27001, to measure the effectiveness of security controls.
Keywords: Security audit, Training, Information Security Analyst, Compliance, Information security, ISO 27001, Vulnerability, Security training, Risk management, Security monitoring

Job Description:
Additionally, Flexera Software is currently actively aiding established employees of the Secunia Research department in pursuing certain certifications like CompTIA Security+ for example
As the Secunia Research has strong ties to Flexera Software s Security Team and Product Security Teams, such certifications can easily support career opportunities into security management or similar
Responsibilities:
Analyze vulnerability information gathered by the Secunia Research departments robots within Web Applications, Open Source, Binary Applications and Embedded devices
Write up advisories based on analysis - advisories written by the Research team follows a very specific template, where information learned during the analysis is inputted into the advisory in a structured form Success measurement is the number of mistakes made. Grammatical errors, spelling, factual, faulty analysis
Perform QA of advisories written by other team members in the future
Ensure that Research stays true to its no mistakes mantra, and QA advisories written by your colleagues. Success measurement is the number of mistakes found
Perform internal scripting tasks to automate and make processes more efficient (mainly done in Python, C#, and PHP)
Analyze and document the core problems of specific critical vulnerabilities using debugging tools (e.g. IDA Pro, and BinDiff)
Researching new vulnerabilities in high-profile products
Required:
Passionate about Security
A sound interest and knowledge in software security including Vulnerability analysis, reverse engineering and disassembly in the specific product contexts like security best practices
Programming experience (preferably C, C++, PHP and Python)

Job Description:
The Principal Information Security Analyst has the responsibility for complex analytics involving industry trending, evaluating the security landscape globally both internal and external to the company, monitoring and reacting to advanced persistent threats, and delivering intelligence surrounding corporate security posture and conditions within Security. Principal Analyst Information Security is responsible for the overall security posture of the company performing strategic level threat assessments, primarily in a proactive sense though at time reactive.
The Principal Analyst Information Security will proactively protect the network by researching the latest security trends and provide direction to the security team to prepare/deploy mitigation strategies.
Essential Responsibilities:
Stay abreast of new threats and continuously evaluate current processes and tool sets.
Recommends new approaches that allow greater standardization and more effective management of information security measures.
Maintain and develop SLAs and monthly operational reporting and metrics on the effectiveness of security tools and processes.
Develop, maintain, and enhance related policies, documentation and procedures.
Responsible for maintaining confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information, applications, infrastructure, and cloud environments.
Assist in the identification, response, investigation, and remediation of security events and incidents as needed.
Ensures adequate audit trails exist for the detection, investigation, correction, and/or disciplinary action related to information security breaches, violations, and other incidents.
Enforce policies and follow up with risk and exception management
Provide technical support and escalation path for resolving incidents and requests
Work directly with third party providers, HR, Legal and others for investigations
Support ongoing and emerging cybersecurity projects and tasks across the organization.
Work closely with the technical teams, and collaborate with the architecture, network and data center teams
Help design and facilitate the maturity of the cyber defense operations center
Mentor cyber security team to develop skills and competencies
Provide input into the evaluation, planning, configuration, and implementation of both new and existing security initiatives.
Evaluates, tests, monitors, and maintains information systems (IS) and cyber security policies, procedures and systems I Creates, implements and oversees identity management systems to meet specific security needs and complex compliance standards
Ensures that IS and cyber security plans, controls, processes, standards, policies and procedures are aligned with IS standards and overall IS and cyber security
Identifies security risks and exposures, determines the causes of security violations and suggests procedures to halt future incidents and improve security
Develops techniques and procedures for conducting IS, cyber security and access and identity risk assessments and compliance audits, the evaluation and testing of hardware, firmware and software for possible impact on system security, and the investigation and resolution of security incidents such as intrusion, frauds, attacks or leaks
Other Responsibilities:
Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety Security requirements, and programs.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor s Degree in Information Security or related discipline.
Bachelors Degree With 2-4 years of experience, Masters Degree With 1-2 years of experience.
Able to communicate in English
Solid understanding of network technologies and protocols
Experience with IPS/IDS, SIEM, Firewalls and Proxies
Firm understanding of Security incident handling procedures
Ability to perform forensic analysis, threat hunting and penetration testing
Excellent communication skills
Comfortable with directing and leading the work of others.
Ability to prioritize, schedule and track to deadlines individual work and the work of others
Travel - Up to 10%
Fluency in English Language - written verbal.
Preferred Qualifications
Working knowledge in the Semiconductor industry
Excellent technical documentation skills
SANS GIAC Security Essentials (GSEC)
CompTIA PenTest+
Project management skills - i.e., the ability to innovate and execute on solutions that matter; the ability to navigate ambiguity.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong planning organizational skills.
Keywords: Semiconductor, Information security, microsoft, Operations, Technical support, Analytics, Monitoring, Recruitment, Auditing, Technical documentation

Job Description:
We are seeking an Information Security Analyst who will assist in establishing, monitoring, and maintaining information security solutions to support the organization.
Qualification Requirements
Bachelors degree or equivalent discipline
8 years of experience in information security and technology
Experience with IT Security solutions
Experience establishing and driving security processes and procedures
Working knowledge of security standards such as ISO 27001, NIST CSF, etc.
Commitment to high quality customer service
Excellent interpersonal/communication skills
Excellent documentation skills
Principal Roles Responsibilities
This role will assist in the implementation and execution of our newly created cyber security function. This will include the selection of security tools where needed, management of existing security platforms, and establishment and streamlining of procedures and processes.
Experience with management, monitoring, and tuning of managed SIEM / SOC services including responding to alerts, monitoring device/system compliance, adding new systems to the platform.
Implementation of email security controls including the creation and implementation of policies and monitoring for threats. This includes URL and attachment security controls.
Assist in the establishment of standards for endpoint security posture including workstations and servers including IaaS and SaaS.
Assist in the development and monitoring of next gen endpoint security platforms.
Collaborate with the team to implement privileged access management and help enforce its application to the environment.
Monitor the dark web for threats against the organization using third party solutions.
Work with the organization to implement appropriate security controls to SaaS platforms to bolster their security.
Work with the team to effectively segment production and development environments as needed to enhance the security footing of the organization.
Assist with the operation and analysis of the vulnerability management platform to ensure updates are being properly applied identifying issues to be addressed.
Participate in the management of cyber security training platform.
Assist with the development and refinement of incident response processes.
Participate in periodic third party security audits and testing.
Stay current on security trends and issues.
Technical Knowledge and Capabilities
Perform well under pressure of active incidents and tight project deadlines.
Must be able to handle multiple assignments / projects simultaneously.
Display a solid work ethic and provide the best possible support on a timely basis.
Have a mindset of continuous improvement.
Be able to work independently with minimal supervision and deliver results on schedule.
Achievement of CISSP, CISM, or similar preferred.
Enterprise networking and infrastructure background a plus.
Knowledge of SIEM tools, understanding of cyber incidents and risk mitigation practices
Knowledge of Identity and Access Management technologies, concepts, and best practices
Certification
ISC2 CISSP, ISACA CISM or similar desired.
Networking certifications such as CCNA, CCNP, or similar experience a plus.

Job Description:
Information Security Analyst: Develops and executes security controls, defenses and counter measures to intercept and prevent internal or external attacks or attempts to infiltrate company email, data, e-commerce and web-based systems. Researches attempted or successful efforts to compromise systems security and designs counter measures. Maintains hardware, software and network firewalls and encryption protocols. Administers security policies to control physical and virtual access to systems. Provides information to management regarding the negative impact on the business caused by theft, destruction, alteration or denial of access to information and systems.
Job Requirements
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Ability to work collaboratively and begin to act in a team lead role with other Network Security Engineering team members to support deadlines; ability to work independently as well.
Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently with competing deadlines.
Strong understanding of documentation procedures for systems, changes and desk level procedures.
Solid operational knowledge of common security technologies (e.g.ACLs - basic, extended/reflexive, Firewall, IDS/IPS, VPN, etc.); and experience in hands on support and configuration ability in at least one security technologies; competent at intermediate change configurations in more than one security technologies.
Familiarity with SIEM solutions such as Splunk, Qradar etc. along with good correlation & analytical skill.
Knowledge and operational experience with other security technologies that can affect change management, security management, audit and control, encryptions, etc.
Administrative experience in multiple versions of operating systems such as Windows, Solaris, BSD, Linux, SCO, HPUX, etc.- Solid scripting ability in Shell, PERL, Python, or other similar use language.
Demonstrated technical writing skills for documentation and process.
Ability to follow documented daily procedures and policies; monitoring tools and response guidelines, escalation and notification processes; and Trouble/Ticket management processes and guidelines.
Aptitude for troubleshooting and resolving issues even in unfamiliar environments.
Basic understanding of threat hunting & malware reverse engineering.
Education
Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor s degree; or 3 years and a Master s degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience.
Keywords: Change management, Linux, VPN, Technical writing, Solaris, Analytical, Windows, Troubleshooting, Operations, Firewall

Job Description:
Security Infrastructure Management:
Configure, deploy, and maintain security infrastructure, including firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and antivirus solutions.
Conduct regular vulnerability assessments and penetration testing to identify and remediate security weaknesses.
Incident Response:
Develop and maintain an incident response plan.
Investigate security incidents, analyze root causes, and implement corrective actions.
Coordinate with external incident response teams if necessary.
Security Policy and Compliance:
Develop and enforce security policies, standards, and procedures.
Ensure compliance with industry regulations and standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, ISO 27001).
Security Awareness and Training:
Provide security training and awareness programs for employees.
Promote a culture of security within the organization.
Threat Monitoring and Analysis:
Monitor network traffic for suspicious activities and potential threats.
Stay up-to-date with the latest security threats and vulnerabilities, and proactively implement security measures to protect against them.
Security Documentation:
Maintain up-to-date documentation of security configurations, incident reports, and security policies.
Security Audits and Assessments:
Participate in internal and external security audits and assessments.
Ensure timely remediation of identified vulnerabilities and findings.
Emerging Technologies Evaluation:
Research and evaluate emerging cyber security technologies and tools.
Make recommendations for their adoption to enhance the organization's security posture.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related field (Master's degree preferred).
Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), or equivalent certifications.
Proven experience in cyber security roles with a strong understanding of security principles and best practices.
Knowledge of security frameworks such as NIST, CIS, or ISO 27001.
Proficiency in security tools and technologies, including firewall management, intrusion detection systems, and SIEM solutions.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work well in a collaborative team environment.
Keywords: Cyber Security, Training, ISO, HIPAA, Infrastructure Management, Documentation, SIEM, CISSP, GDPR, CISM

Job Description:
As an SAP Security Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring the security and compliance of our SAP systems. You will work closely with the IT and security teams to protect sensitive data, maintain user access controls, and mitigate security risks within the SAP environment. This role requires a deep understanding of SAP security concepts and strong technical skills in S4HANA, BW, Fiori, ECC, GRC and HANA DB
Responsibilities:
1. SAP Security Administration:
- Manage user access and authorization in SAP systems.
- Create, modify, and delete user roles and profiles.
- Implement security policies, procedures, and guidelines for SAP environments.
- Conduct regular security audits and vulnerability assessments.
2. Security Policy Compliance:
- Ensure compliance with relevant security standards and regulations (e.g., GDPR, SOX).
- Monitor and report on security compliance metrics.
- Implement and enforce SAP security best practices.
3. Incident Response and Troubleshooting:
- Investigate and respond to security incidents in SAP systems.
- Collaborate with IT and security teams to resolve security-related issues.
- Perform root cause analysis and recommend remediation actions.
4. Security Enhancement:
- Stay up-to-date with SAP security trends and threats.
- Propose and implement security enhancements and improvements.
- Participate in SAP system upgrades and projects from a security perspective.
5. Documentation and Training:
- Maintain documentation of SAP security configurations and policies.
- Provide training and guidance to SAP users and IT teams on security best practices.
Qualifications:
Deep knowledge of various aspects of SAP Security, both from a technical as well as business process perspective.
Hands on experience on role design and user management in ECC, BW, Java, BPC as well as S/4 HANA, Fiori and HANA DB
Experience with SAP GRC Access Control for centralized risk management, compliant provisioning and role administration.
Experience in handling Segregation of Duties (SOD) Risks, applying mitigation controls, supervising sensitive access and elevated privileges.
knowledge on Onapsis tool and vulnerability and threats knowledge is a plus
3+ years of Security Administration experience
Should be able to work on minor projects independently
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Relevant certifications, such as SAP Certified Security Consultant, CISSP, or CISM, are preferred.
Keywords: Business process, Cism, remediation, SAP, SAP security, Security Analyst, Vulnerability, Troubleshooting, Risk management, User management

Job Description:
OVERVIEW:
Skillsoft is seeking an Information Security Analyst (SA) to join the CISO office. The CISO office provides operational security and privacy support to Skillsoft SaaS products, Business applications (Backoffice), Information Technology and other internal departments.
The candidate will coordinate security audits and security technology implementations with key stakeholders in the organization including IT, Business Applications, HR, Procurement and SaaS Cloud Operations/DevOps.
The role requires hands on utilization of security scan tools to perform Application Security Scans, Network Penetration tests and assessment of the scan results, including remediation recommendation.
The candidate must have in depth knowledge of security compliance frameworks such as NIST, ISO 27001/2, SOC2. Understanding of FedRAMP is a plus. The candidate must have knowledge with IaaS deployments, primarily AWS and Azure.
This role reports to Skillsoft s Chief Information Security Officer.
OPPORTUNITY HIGHLIGHTS:
Conduct network and application penetration tests both with automated tools and manual techniques
Share results and work on remediation timelines with key stakeholders
Verify remediation results and report on remediation progress
Scan IaaS deployments to identify misconfigurations that pose security risks and work with Key stakeholders on remediation
Help evaluate security tools and recommend implementation
Collect security metrics from key stakeholders and compile results for dashboards and presentations
Assist the RFP/RFI teams with security aspects of questionnaires.
SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS :
Hands on expertise with security scanning tools: Nessus, Burp,
Experience working within a security framework i.e. ISO27001 or SOC2
Experience with FedRAMP and PCI-DSS is a plus
Prior work experience in an environment that sells SaaS products
Experience with AWS and Azure deployments
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional team i.e., Product, Software Engineering and IT
The ideal candidate will hold one or more security certifications and be extremely familiar with IT security both inside and outside of U.S. corporations including SaaS product delivery.
Keywords: Procurement, PCI DSS, Penetration, Information security, ISO 27001, Agile, Application security, Nessus, Information technology, RFP

Job Title: Cyber Security Engineer---Automotive experience is mandatory
Job Description:
Role: Senior Cybersecurity Engineer
Location: Sweden
Duration: Permanent

Position is a Senior roll with CS background also ability to work as change manager, social interaction and documented technical knowledge is necessary. ISO/SAE 21434 knowledge and also generic CS background is needed. practical experience of working with TARA, CS case and vulnerability is a plus.
Senior Cybersecurity Engineer/Cybersecurity Change Manager
We are looking for a senior cybersecurity engineer working as facilitator and coordinator of cybersecurity management system (CSMS) implementation on product streams level.
The position also called change manager and previous experience as Change Manager specifically within automotive domain is plus.
The candidate will report directly to product cybersecurity director and work as technical and administrative interface between Cybersecurity department owning PCSMS and R&D teams who perform CS activities.
The candidate needs to have good understanding of UNECE R155 implication in addition to ISO/SAE 21434 work products, also hands on experience of performing TARA, CS case and Cybersecurity incident review.
Candidate need to be familiar with Attack vector analysis, Vulnerability analysis and Incident response process.
The work conducted in a cross functional layout where cooperation and determination of key responsible persons are essential to be able to execute daily tasks.
Therefore, it is needed to have a social person since interaction with number of people in daily work is a natural part of the tasks within this roll.
Technical knowledge about SW (i.e. solution for authentication or Boot loader ,..) and HW ( i.e. HSM) with regards to cybersecurity implementation is needed.
The work could require to drive technical investigation to identify the root cause of vulnerabilities also system design review.
Previous experience of working as system design engineer is appreciated.
We need a solution oriented, problem solver, and person with having holistic view in mind and considering final product for risk evaluation and perform impact analysis.


Perks and Benefits
Sponsorship is offered for right candidates residing in India, Sweden, UK & Europe.

Automotive domain experience is mandatory
Keywords: Change Management, ISO/SAE 21434, cyber security, TARA, automotive

Company Name: Classic Technologies And Business Solutions Private Limited
Job Description:
About the Company
Classic Fashion is a truly global enterprise with worldwide sourcing of inputs and global marketing of products. It is the largest apparel manufacturer in the MENA region and ships these premium products to leading international suppliers & fashion brands. 
To fulfil its vision of being a globally recognized and totally trusted source of flawlessly created premium garments using Industry 4.0 factories and machines, we need highly motivated and passionate people who are driven by learning and innovation. 
This is an opportunity to thrive in a rapidly growing environment by developing and applying next-gen solutions to secure world-class manufacturing facilities and enterprise infrastructure from information security threats. 
Reasons to join our team: 
Contribute actively towards technical roadmaps and innovation plans, both internally and with customers and suppliers, with a focus on security architecture. 
Provide direction and guidance to internal teams for secure design, implementation, and operations with a focus on minimizing security risks. 


Roles & Responsibilities
Collaborate with internal stakeholders, customers, and suppliers to define the security requirements and align them to the business objectives. 
Work closely with technology and operations teams to design and implement feasible solutions as per the requirements. 
Ensure that the processes for maintaining the implemented solutions are kept up-to-date and maintain the technology infrastructure so that it stays resilient with the evolving threat landscape. 
Advocate for security to be ingrained as a part of the organizations work culture and play an important role in the processes for validating the effectiveness of the implemented security controls. 
Engage with key stakeholders for planning the implementation of controls for key security risks 
Build, install, configure, test, and assist in assessing the impact of implementing and sustaining a dedicated cyber defense infrastructure. 
Troubleshoot, analyze the root cause, actively contribute to the recovery efforts, and maintain constant communication with internal stakeholders and customers in the event of an incident or problem. 
Review and drive the implementation of appropriate mitigations for addressing risks resulting from architectural changes that impact the attack surface. 
Drive the implementation of security controls through the use of standard security processes, tools and solutions while adhering to best practices. 
Establish security requirements for information systems by evaluating business needs and implementing security standards such CIS Critical Security Controls, NIST CSF, etc. as appropriate. 

Requirements
Bachelors Degree in Information Technology, Information Security/Assurance, Computer Engineering or similar area of study; at least 3-5 years related experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience preferred; demonstrated understanding of Information Security required. 
Ability to lead the design, implementation, and operations of security in a distributed technology infrastructure while applying key security principles including but not limited to Defence-in-Depth, Secure-by-Design, etc. 
Skilled in threat modelling, methods for assessing and mitigating risks, and defining security requirements to support various technology and operations teams. 
Knowledge of specific operational impacts of cybersecurity lapses and skilled in applying cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements. 
Knowledge of incident response and handling methodologies, data backup and recovery principles, network traffic analysis techniques, and host/network access control mechanisms. 
Skill in protecting a network against malware, troubleshooting and diagnosing cyber defense infrastructure anomalies and work through resolution. 
Maintain knowledge of applicable cyber defense policies, regulations, and compliance documents and orchestrate technical and nontechnical risk and vulnerability assessments of relevant technology focus areas. 
Experienced in writing technical documents, project plans and progress reports to leadership, stakeholders, engineers and customers.
Keywords: Cyber Security, Critical Security Controls, NIST CSF

Job Description:
The Managed Services Senior Security Analyst is responsible for security solutions for clients. The Senior Security Analyst will demonstrate the capacity to consistently meet and exceed client expectations representing and reinforcing the Cyderes brand through positive interaction with other teams within the company. Perform deep dive investigations into security threats, understand and implement MITRE mapping to identify customers current security posture.

Responsibilities:
Provide overall guidance, instruction, mentorship, and leadership to other Security Analysts
Perform triage and advanced analysis tasks across endpoint, server, and network infrastructure.
Perform Threat Hunting on customer networks to detect, isolate threats and provide recommendations.
Provide proactive security investigation and searches on client environment to detect malicious activities.
Coordinate Incident investigations and deep dive analysis on detected threats.
Understand and identify indicators of attack and compromise in alerts, by hunting through data, and from review of investigation notes.
Have full understanding of the MITRE ATT&CK framework. Mapping clients use cases to tactics and techniques.
Update documentation and runbooks to ensure repeatable analysis.
Actively participate in an after-hours on-call rotation as Incident Controller
Scope customer security incidents
Senior Security Analyst
Document, communicate recommendations and guidelines based on results of analysis.
Analyze, review, and provide raw log data for more insight into escalations through SIEM.
Communicate effectively orally and in writing.
Maintain current knowledge and understanding of threat landscape.

Requirements:
5 or more years of progressing/in-depth IT security experience. Practical experience in a senior role within the last three years and demonstrated ability to carry out the functions of the job.
System Administration experience (Windows, Unix/Linux, Mac)
Advanced understanding of networking concepts and ability to analyze network artifacts.
Demonstrate experience in using Endpoint Detection and Response software (Sentinel1, Crowdstrike, Defender ETC.)
Advanced knowledge of at least one leading SIEM platform (Sentinel, Splunk, Elastic, IBM Qradar, Chronicle etc.)
Possess at least one industry certification Sec+, CEH, SANS Certification (e.g. GCIH, GCIA, GSEC, GMON), OSCP etc. or working towards a related certification.
Prior knowledge of SOAR platform such as Siemplify, Forti soar etc.
Expert-level Analysis of security events
Basic scripting or development experience in one of the following languages: Python, JavaScript, PowerShell, bash, etc.
Keywords: Unix, Managed services, Linux, Access management, SOC, Javascript, Senior Security Analyst, Windows, Python, System administration

Job Description:
About Fivesky:
We design, deploy, and maintain advanced technologies that enable our customers to achieve operational excellence at substantial OpEx savings. Our core strengths include a concentration on networks, their security & optimization with a laser focus on redefining the fulfillment experience.


In addition to our core focus in IT security, Fivesky provides our employees a dynamic environment to learn and grow professionally. With 4 years in business and over hundred customers, the company is soon to be recognized on the West Coast as the go- to expert in delivering IT infrastructure solutions to Enterprise customers across a wide variety of industry verticals. Your peers will be senior engineers with specialized expertise in all areas critical to IT environments, including networking, storage, security, cloud, enterprise applications, servers, messaging and virtualization. We are a team of driven professionals that are committed to our customers success and delivering the highest quality of service.


Fivesky s reputation, resources and culture empower talented Senior Windows Security Analyst to succeed.


Job Description
We are looking for a highly motivated and talented Senior Windows Security Analyst to join a fast- paced, dynamic and challenging environment.


The ideal candidate must demonstrate conceptual understanding of windows security. S/ he should have a natural curiosity and initiate interest in technology, security and the ability to work in a diverse team environment. The candidates must also demonstrate the aptitude to work with teams, who will be responsible for supporting Products/ tools related to platform security for a global firm.


As the Senior Windows Security analyst, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:

Provide senior support for production application. Proactively ensure the highest levels of systems and infrastructure stability

Consult internal teams and clients on security tools and provision tools for the different IT security and enterprise infrastructure teams

Provide expert support for variety of security technologies: RSA Archer, Hitachi Privilege Access Management, microsoft public key infrastructure and several other internally developed tools

Response to mitigate risks by utilizing company s tools, policies, process and procedures

Contribute to the central knowledge base by creating, constructing, reviewing, improving and updating documents & publishing corrections related to security.

Perform operational support, and participate in the 24X7 weekly rotation of the on- call emergency response

Cooperate and communicate effectively with clients and colleagues around the globe to ensure procedures and processes meet best practices

Inspect, troubleshoot and resolve problems, become the go to person for sufficient resolution

Design, develop and execute visionary ideas for efficiency and effectiveness, and provide ideas for automation when necessary

Active collaboration with global colleagues to provide globally consistent processes and procedures and provide innovative ideas

Contribute to all business planning and practices by providing insightful ideas.


This is a full- time, direct employment in Bengaluru, Karnataka. Salary is open based on experience & qualifications.


Qualifications:

5- 10 years of Windows security engineering or platform engineering experience

Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or a related discipline

Background in Financial Services industry is a plus.


Skills & Experiences:
Must possess in- depth understanding and prior experience on the following:

Scripting and development in Powershell, VBscript and/ or c# development skills

Microsoft Active Directory, LDAP, Group Policy, DNS / WINS, IIS, clustering, SCCM, SQL (query).

Knowledgeable in one or more of Security technologies: Symantec Endpoint Protection, Symantec Endpoint Encryption, Varonis DataPrivilege and DatAdvantage, Hitachi Privilege, Microsoft Public Key Infrastructure, and Microsoft Threat Management Gateway, and etc.

Firewalls, Routing, NAT, OSI Model, packet trace and analysis, and etc.

Troubleshooting windows operating systems including debugging

Project Management skills with ability to plan and execute effectively

Web Development (HTML, JavaScript)

RedHat Linux, and virtualization technology


Interpersonal Skills:

Must be able to demonstrate problem solving/ troubleshooting skills

Ability to handle multiple projects and meet aggressive deadlines

Ability to work and thrive in a fast- paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse security technologies and techniques

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Should be self- driven and flexible



Benefits:

At Fivesky, our employees are our greatest asset and the focal point around which we operate, therefore, we always want the best for our employees. In addition to offering competitive compensation plans and long- term career opportunities. We offer an attractive mix of benefit plans to our employees that include: provisions for vacation, holiday pay, and sick days.


Fivesky is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law.
Keywords: Automation, Publishing, Operational excellence, Networking, Service, Windows, microsoft, Financial services, Active Directory, SQL

Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled Network Security AdminEngineer to join our team
The AdminEngineer will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining our companys network infrastructure, as well as troubleshooting and resolving network issues as they arise
The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of network protocols, technologies, and topologies, as well as experience with network security hardware and software
Responsibilities:
Design, deploy, and configure Network and firewall devices to meet business requirements
Develop and implement firewall policies and access controls to protect the network infrastructure and data
Monitor network traffic and security logs to identify and respond to potential security incidents
Conduct regular security assessments and vulnerability scans to identify weaknesses and recommend mitigation strategies
Perform firewall rule analysis and optimization to ensure efficient and effective network traffic flow
Provide technical support and troubleshooting expertise for Firewall-related issues
Stay up-to-date with the latest network security trends, threats, and industry best practices
Collaborate with other teams, such as network engineers and system administrators, to ensure a secure and integrated network environment
Participate in the evaluation and selection of network security products and technologies
Monitor network performance and troubleshoot issues as they arise, working closely with other members of NoC team
Develop and maintain network documentation, including network diagrams, configuration files, backup and SOPs
Escalating to the relevant team as required, promptly following procedures and ensuring management is updated accordingly
Ensuring the ticket is up to date at all times on incident progress
Maintain, troubleshoot and co-ordinate replacement of faulty hardware
Involved in the execution of client change requests in a timely manner as planned
Escalation of critical issuesoutages to Operation Centre Manager and Business Manager as per procedures
Provide detailed feedback to other groups on all incident resolutions, ensuring full details are entered into ticket case notes
Daily review and action of open cases; updating Operation Centre Manager on current cases and their status as appropriate
Logging cases to 3rd party vendors requesting assistance on unresolved issues
Requirement:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Security, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
5+ years of experience in network security or a related field
In-depth knowledge of network protocols and technologies, including TCPIP, DNS, DHCP, VLANs, and routing protocols (BGP, OSPF, etc)
Experience on network management tools Solar Winds, Logic Monitor, Data Dog and Zoho site 24X7
Proven experience as a Network Security Engineer with specialization in Fortinet and Sophos Firewall
Experience on Web Application Firewall (WAF) and link load balancer F5, Barracuda, Forcepoint and Radware in any one or two OEM product
In-depth understanding of network protocols, security principles, and best practices
Experience in designing and implementing secure network infrastructures, including firewall policies, VPNs, and intrusion prevention systems
Troubleshooting basic Server problems
Experience of using Ticket Management tools
Escalations are performed within the SLA timescales
Engineering and Senior Management are kept abreast of appropriate escalations
Knowledge of Email Security tool
Good knowledge in OSI Layer and TCPIP Model
In-depth troubleshooting and strong analytical skills
Use of packet capturing technologies such as Wireshark and NetScout
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment
Good knowledge in VPN technologies and security protocols like IPsec, ISAKMP, SSL, PKI, RADIUS, TACAC
Relevant certifications, such as CCNA, CCNP Fortinet Network Security Expert (NSE) or Fortinet Certified Network Security Administrator (FCNSA), are highly desirable
Good knowledge of SIEM tools integration and monitoring
Strong knowledge of Windows Server and system security principles and best practices
Knowledge of incident response procedures and techniques
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills

A fun-life balance.
Culture of openness and flexibility which allows employees to keep growing and gravitating to roles that fit their talents and passions.

Job Description:
The Cons. Security Analyst, Compliance/GRC is responsible for implementing, improving, maintaining, and reporting on our security governance, risk, and compliance programs.
You will quickly mature our function, adopting newly established policies within the agreed SLA, with the establishment of new, or improved Process Controls working closely with the Information Security organization as well as business units and stakeholders.
As the primary point of contact for all internal and external audits, you will create a lean and efficient operation, in addition to establishing and managing organizational operating and executive level metrics. The continuous improvement and alignment of SkillsoftÃÂs information security corporate policies, implementation standards, and technical hardening specifications are part of your DNA.
OPPORTUNITY HIGHLIGHTS:
Lead the implementation of necessary information security policies, standards, procedures, and guidelines to support SkillsoftÃÂs requirements. This includes any client specific policies enforced on projects requiring an increased level of security.
Leads the design and operation of related compliance monitoring and improvement activities to ensure compliance both with internal security policies, Skillsoft customer policies and any applicable laws and regulations.
Proactively conduct periodic security risk assessments by working with the team and determine appropriate actions to address identified risks.
Is responsible for prevention of IT security risks and issues and will develop and deliver suitable information security awareness, training and educational activities to the associates, managers and others as needed.
Coordinate, execute, and implement activities relating to contingency planning, business continuity management and IT disaster recovery in conjunction with relevant functions and third parties.
Coordinate policy adoption, procedure drafting and implementation across pillar owners in Digital & IT, including:
Managing the pipeline of policies for procedure documentation (procedure adoption will be prioritized by D&IT Leadership).
Working with Information Security team to establish a set of controls associated with each policy.
Providing each application owner with both a framework procedure document aligned to each policy, and the required support to complete it.
Capturing where controls are currently met and where gaps exist.
Identifying SOX related controls and ensuring that procedures include all relevant SOX controls.
Must stay current with industry, regulatory, and legal requirements relevant to security, compliance, and privacy.
Should create and maintain internal control narratives, flowcharts, and risk matrices.
Should have a firm grasp of governance, risk, and controls in a cloud-based IT environment with a technical understanding of IT infrastructure.
SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or Bachelor of Technology in IT / Computer Science.
At least 8 years of progressive work experience in Information Security management and/or related functions (such as IT Audit or IT Risk Management).
Excellent Implementation Knowledge of ISO 27001:2013/2022, NIST, StateRAMP, FedRAMP, SOX, leading up to certification is required for the above standards.
Knowledge of information system architecture and security controls (i.e., firewall and border router configurations, operating systems configurations, wireless architectures, databases, specialized appliances, access control systems and information security policies and procedures).
Knowledge of principles, practices, and procedures of Information Security as it applies to and impacts the organization.
Experience with Incident Response and Analysis, Information Security breaches, violations and incidents.
Information Security management qualifications such as Certified Information Systems Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)/ Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) are preferred.
Strong verbal, written and presentation skills. Ability to interface effectively and decisively with all levels of management, departments, and outside vendors.
Strong leadership, organizational, decision-making, and analytical skills.
A passion about solving security challenges.
High personal and professional ethical standards.
Expert and demonstratable experience with governance, risk, and compliance tools.
Ability to present security risks to wide audience including senior management.
Ability to understand the end-to-end processes supporting IT, data, and security.
Keywords: Information Security, it risk management, it audit, security analysis, it security, security compliance, IT infrastructure, cisa, information security management, cism

Job Description:
The Cyber Security Analyst is a member of the Security Operations Centre responsible for the protection of the company's online and corporate systems. This role is member of company's security incident response team (SIRT) that performs incident and forensic investigations across all of the company. This role participates in a 24x7x365 work effort and in such will be required at times to work after hours and participate in an on-call rotation.

Key Responsibilities:
Monitor information security alerts from firewalls, IDS, OS, Anti-Virus, servers, and other security tools through the use of a SIEM.
Level 1 analysis of intrusions to network, application, and infrastructure related devices.
Detect and document anomalies identified on the network.
Participate as a member of the incident response team.
Maintain or assist in the maintenance of the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all data in physical and/or electronic format.
Support cyber security initiatives through both predictive and reactive analysis.

Education And Experience:
3-5 years in the information security field
Experience with a variety of operating systems (Windows/Linux/Unix/Mac).
Familiarity with security tools and frameworks

Skills And Knowledge:
High level understanding of computer networks and communications
Conceptual knowledge of well-known protocols and services like FTP, HTTP, SSH, SMB, LDAP
Fundamental understanding of the defense-in-depth strategies
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.

Job Description:
Your mission and responsibilities:
You will be responsible for driving the defence of our network both on-prem and in the cloud.
You will act as a subject matter expert for network security topics.
You will be part of a global team focusing on the protection of IT assets in general (endpoints, infrastructure, network, applications, cloud environments, Microsoft 365) distributed all over the world (Europe, America, and Asia).
You will work closely with peers and colleagues across Network Engineering, Cybersecurity Operations and Cybersecurity Governance to ensure that implementation and operations are aligned with security standards and bets practices.
Task and responsibilities:
You will develop, drive, and implement network security strategy.
You will identify, define, and implement capabilities as well as processes to increase the security of our network and network transfer points.
You will be the go-to person for internal projects related to network security.
What is in it for you:
You will enjoy a flexible work schedule with up to 80% remote working based on your personal preference.
You will thrive in a multinational environment where you will have the chance to meet and cooperate with colleagues from all over the globe.
You will participate in big security projects, introducing improvements that will make a difference on the daily work of over 65k employees. Organization, coordination, and communication are key to succeed.
You will have the chance to constantly increase your knowledge and develop your skills by combining training courses with on-the-job training.
You will develop a successful career by participating in all relevant stages: Definition, planning, implementation, and supervision.
Qualifications:
You have at least 5 years of experience as Cybersecurity Network Engineer, Architect, or related functional areas.
You have subject matter expertise with NGFWs, WAFs, Web Gateways, DDoS mitigation, network traffic monitoring/analysis and security architecture.
Desirable: You have experience in configuration and administration of network security devices from leading vendors.
You have a solid understanding of cloud networking technologies and design principles, as well as next generation network security technologies (e.g., software defined network architectures, SASE, ZTNA).
Desirable: You completed relevant network related certifications or other Industry Certifications such as GDSA, CRTSA, CISSP-ISSAP, CISM, CISA, or ISSAP.
Keywords: Cism, Networking, Cisa, Network engineering, Cloud, Network security, Subject matter expertise, Subject Matter Expert, microsoft, Monitoring

Job Description:
You drive the administration, implementation, innovation, and continuous improvement for Healthineers security regarding security tools in your responsibility.
You will be part of a global team focusing on the protection of IT assets in general (endpoints, infrastructure, network, applications, cloud environments, Microsoft 365) distributed all over the world (Europe, America, and Asia).

You will be the go-to person for security tools in your area of responsibility.
Qualifications:

Endpoint protection solutions eg, EPP/EDR/AV, DLP, SIEM

You are a person who understands the Business needs as well as the technical risks, and proposes risk-oriented approaches, translating technical information to business language.
You enjoy engaging with different teams and facilitating discussions to find solutions that meet stakeholder s expectations.
