Job Description:
Job Description:

The Security Operation Center (SOC) and Incident Response (IR) Lead is a senior leader who is
responsible for the design, build-out, and day-to-day operations of the Security Operations Center
(SOC) and Incident Response capabilities. The SOC & IR Lead will oversee a team of SOC analysts
and will be responsible for ensuring that the SOC is effectively monitoring, detecting, and
responding to security events.
The SOC & IR Lead will report to the CISO and, in addition to working with their SOC team, will work
closely with InfoSec, IT Operations, and Product teams to ensure the security of the organization's
information assets. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of information security
principles and practices, as well as experience setting up a Security Operations Center.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

The SOC & IR Lead will:
Oversee the day-to-day operations of the SOC, including the management of security
analysts, the development and implementation of security policies and procedures, and
the response to security alerts.
Manage a team of SOC analysts
Ensure that the SOC is effectively monitoring, detecting, and responding to security
incidents
Ensure that the SOC is aligned with the organization's overall security strategy
Represent the SOC to senior management and other stakeholders
Stay up-to-date on the latest security threats and trends
Develop and maintain relationships with security vendors
Investigate security incidents and recommend corrective actions.
Train and develop security operations analysts
Stay up-to-date on the latest security trends and technologies.
Report on security incidents and trends to the CISO and other senior management.
Refine and develop SOC operating procedures
Develop SIEM use cases for monitoring, investigative techniques, and health checks for
optimization
Focus on continual improvement of core functions of the SOC
Promote security education and awareness across the organization

QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

Bachelors degree in business, computer science, information systems, engineering, or a
related discipline Â Masters Degree
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

7+ years of experience working in a SOC
In depth knowledge of SOC for cloud environments
Strong understanding of security principles and best practices
Ability to train others to configure and define use cases for SIEM tools
Experience with security tools and technologies, such as SIEM, firewalls, IDS, IPS, DLP, EPP,
Email Security gateway, etc.
Knowledge of TCP/IP and other network protocols (DNS, DHCP, HTTP, FTP, SNMP, SMTP,
RDP, SSH, etc)
Knowledge, Windows, Linux, IaaS, and SaaS logs
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Self-motivated and results-oriented, agile mindset, with excellent interpersonal and
communication skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Prior experience working with startups in a dynamic environment and SaaS companies
would be an added advantage
CERTIFICATIONS (DESIRABLE, BUT NOT MANDATORY)
CISA. CISM, CEH, CISSP
AWS / Azure /GCP security certification (any)
Keywords: Incident Response, SOC, SIEM, Security Operations Center

Job Description:
Luminar Technologies is seeking an experienced technically hands-on senior manager, to be a Product Security Lead Engineer (LiDAR) reporting to the Director of Security Engineering, who can design, build, monitor and enforce the security processes and infrastructure for advanced LiDAR products within a growing US public company
The ideal candidate should have extensive experience in designing security solutions which protect information from threats, ensuring business continuity and regulatory compliance by collaboratively working across the different functions in the organization
Responsibilities
Build and lead a best-in-class product security program for Lidar, firmware, and Perception development initiatives
Partner with key stakeholders including: IT, Advanced manufacturing, LiDAR Product, Software, and Customer teams to ensure business outcomes are met on-time, on budget, in a safe secure manner
Work closely with Product & Software Perception teams as the primary security advisor and embedded security engineering subject matter expert on all product and project teams
Support internal & external audits as a subject matter expert, as necessary
Manage cybersecurity tasks and timing in overall project management plan
Manage the development of processes and work product content according to ISO/SAE 21434, including Item Definition, Cybersecurity Plan, TARA, Cybersecurity Concept, System, hardware and software Vulnerability Analyses, etc
Manage third-party contractors and/or junior engineers and security analysts developing and converting existing work products, as necessary
Support development of cybersecurity concept specifications and the implementation of embedded system risk treatments, including secure boot, secure flash and secure communications (using message authentication codes)
Partner with Legal and Supply Chain teams to develop, implement, and maintain a world-class supply chain security & resilience program for our core LiDAR & Perception product lines
Ensure compliance to secure coding standards
Support the planning and implementation of cybersecurity risk treatments in manufacturing and production, including strategy for key management as well as analyzing network security and other IT risk treatments via a manufacturing TARA
Support meetings and communication on cybersecurity content with customers
Work as part of a cross-functional team with other customer program members and roles to complete work products and implement cybersecurity risk treatments
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor s of Science degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Cybersecurity, Systems Engineering, or a related field (or documented relevant work experience)
8+ years of managerial experience and documented technical proficiency in product security or a combination of general cybersecurity experience and hands-on technical experience with products in technology, automotive, or manufacturing sectors
Deep knowledge and proven technical proficiency in international standards and critical security technologies, to include: ISO/SAE 21434 & 2700X, NIST, cryptography, hardware- software interface security, ZeroTrust design & frameworks, product security risks and risk treatments
Deep domain expertise in implementation of basic product security risk treatments, including secure boot, secure flash, secure communications, including SecOC or MACSec
Experience with agile engineering processes
Deep system and software expertise and documented technical proficiency with product security & cybersecurity at a management and engineering level
Experience with other quality processes (ASPICE, ISO 26262, AUTOSAR)
Experience with agile engineering processes
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills and ability to motivate others, drive collaboration, and quickly resolve conflicts
Enjoy working within a dynamic and continuously evolving environment
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues
Ability & willingness to work in a 24/7 on-call capacity in emergencies across global time zones
Highly self-motivated and directed with attention to detail
Native-level professional English fluency required, additional language ability a plus
Valid passport with no restrictions on business travel to Luminar s areas of operation
Travel up to 10% (according to relevant national and international COVID-19 safety guidelines)
Preferred Qualifications
6+ years of general automotive engineering experience
Experience with cryptographic key management in a production environment
Experience with sensors and perception
Experience with trust anchors, e.g., Hardware Security Modules from multiple semiconductor vendors
Experience working with semiconductor and software suppliers on cybersecurity requirements
Experience working with cybersecurity service providers and contractors
Extensive experience in C++ for safety-critical applications; prefer ADAS or highly autonomous vehicle software experience.
Strong software engineering experience in vehicle safety critical embedded systems,
Demonstrated experience in embedded software testing as it pertains to automotive safety-critical software.
Experience in structural coverage of code - static and dynamic analysis .
Show out-of-box thinking and invent creative solutions for challenging problems.
Keywords: Supply chain, C++, ISO, Coding, Project management, Agile, Network security, Firmware, Troubleshooting, Automotive

Experience with security information and event management (SIEM) tools.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Leadership, teambuilding, and mentoring skills. Strong communication, interpersonal, and conflict resolution skills

Job Description:
Candidate's Job Title MSG- SOC Analyst -L4
Educational Qualification B.E/B.Tech, B.Sc, BCA, M.E/M.Tech/MS, M.Sc, MBA, MCA
Experience Required (yrs) 3 - 5 years

Job Summary
This role is part of our Managed Services team to serve as the primary responder to security events within the Security Operations Center. The ideal candidate would have a strong problem-solving skills and analytics aptitude. This role participates in security posture monitoring and threat response activities and is directly responsible for troubleshooting security events. The preferred candidate will provide the initial analysis during security incidents, establishing the extent of the threat, business impacts and then advising and performing the most suitable course of action to contain and remedy the incident. The SOC Analyst must maintain a good knowledge of the threat landscape, help enhance current capabilities and provides support in the identification of new methods of detecting threats.
Job Duties
Â Monitor security event platforms and follow incident playbook for first response, triage, potential resolution and participate in post mortem activities as required.
Â Conducts network monitoring and intrusion detection analysis using various network defense tools, such as intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS), firewalls, host-based security systems (HBSS), Azure security and audit log management etc.
Â Provide proactive feedback to enable improvement of the current monitoring rules, based on information and knowledge/experience
Â Ability to react quickly, decisively and deliberately in high-stress, high-impact situations
Â Creates daily, weekly, and monthly report for Security Management Team
Â Performs front line response and escalation tasks and updates runbooks and procedures as needed
Â Compile statistics and contribute to the improvement and creation of playbooks
Â Use public cyber security resources (e.g. sites/blogs/podcasts) to stay up to date with latest news, threats, and security analysis tools
Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Education
Â High School Diploma or GED, required
Â Bachelors Degree from an accredited university, Information Technology or Computer Science major, preferred
Experience
Â Two (2) or more years experience within cloud technologies such as Azure, Azure Stack Azure Backups, AWS or similar cloud experience, required
Â Two (2) or more years experience of network protocols, configurations, or operations required
Â Two (2) or more years of experience in infosec, cybersecurity, system or networking, required
Â Ability to triage problems, design and identify solutions and appropriately escalate issues in fast-paced environment, required
Â Some Experience with EDR platform or SIEM Platform, required
Â Prior experience with help desk ticketing systems and service desk management tools, preferred
License(s)/Certification(s)
Â Any Security certifications, preferred (SC200 recommended)
Â Azure certifications, preferred (AZ104 recommended)
Â System / Networking certifications, preferred
Experience with three or more of the following, required
Â Information Security tools & packet analyses tools (e.g. CB, Wireshark)
Â Intrusion Detection (e.g. IDS/IPS tools)
Â Firewall troubleshooting experience
Â Strong Windows and Linux experience
Â Internet Protocols and Services (e.g. TCP/IP, FTP, HTTPS, SSH)
Â Networking infrastructure
Â Log analysis/ Windows event analysis
Â Network and Host basic forensics
Â Antivirus solutions
Â Strong troubleshooting and root cause analyses skills

Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Â Strong oral and written communication skills
Â Excellent interpersonal and customer relationship skills
Â Capacity to work in a deadline-driven environment while handling multiple projects/tasks simultaneously with a focus on details
Â Capable of successfully multi-tasking while working independently or within a group environment

Job Description:
Financial Analyst: A financial analyst evaluates financial data, assesses investment opportunities, analyzes market trends, and provides recommendations to individuals or organizations regarding investment decisions, portfolio management, and financial planning
Business Analyst: Business analysts work to understand an organization's business processes, identify areas for improvement, gather and analyze data, and make recommendations to enhance efficiency, productivity, and overall business performance
Data Analyst: Data analysts collect, process, and analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions
They often use tools like Excel, SQL, and data visualization software
Market Analyst: Market analysts research market trends, consumer behavior, and competitive landscape in a specific industry to provide insights that guide marketing and sales strategies
Research Analyst: Research analysts study various subjects, such as market trends, scientific data, social issues, or public policy, to produce reports and findings that contribute to informed decision-making
Policy Analyst: Policy analysts assess and evaluate public policies, proposals, and programs to provide recommendations to government agencies, nonprofit organizations, or other entities
Security Analyst: Security analysts focus on cybersecurity, monitoring networks and systems for potential threats, analyzing security breaches, and implementing measures to protect against cyberattacks
Keywords: Sales strategy, Financial planning, Security Analyst, Data Analyst, data visualization, Research Analyst, Market Analyst, Portfolio management, Monitoring, SQL

Job Description:
Be a part of the Application Security team under the CyberSecurity organization as an Application Security Analyst and work closely with the Application Development, Database Security and CloudDevOps team to ensure that any software developed or acquired meets the stringent standards while enabling rapid innovation to meet our firm and clients everchanging needs.
Successful candidates will be security evangelists who can translate security concepts into language that is meaningful to many audiences, including business and technical leaders and individual contributors.
Candidates must be able to approach application security from the perspective of risk management and avoid purely academic thinking about software security.
Conduct complex compromise analysis and work with resolver groups to ensure the timely mitigation of security events.
Perform forensic investigations. Identify and assess threat intelligence sources recommending relevant requisite actions, gaining agreement, and facilitating implementation.
Conduct security assessments and Threat modelling including penetration testing and vulnerability assessments.
Should be willing to support and be available during non-working hours in case of emergency situations.
Responsibilities
Improving and maintaining secure development standards
Integrating security tools, standards, and processes into the product life cycle (PLC)
Integrating threat modeling practices into the product life cycle.
Ensuring that developers and QA personnel are updated with the appropriate level of security knowledge to perform their daily activities
Improving and supporting application security tool deployments including SAST, DAST, SCA etc.
Supporting the incident response and architecture review processes
Managing and collaborating in the annual 3rd party vulnerability & penetration testing services
Provide manual penetration testing and standards gap analysis of the Digital environment including SaaS applications
Manage application framework and security improvement & optimization related projects
Supporting Vendor Security activities to ensure 3rd party software and development meets EgonZehnder security standards
Producing metrics reporting the state of application security programs
Skills:
Prior work experience in application security
Should have exposure on Cloud and DevSecOps
Candidates should be familiar with waterfall and agile development processes and have experience integrating secure development practices into both models
Familiarity with a variety of development and testing tools like BurpSuite, Invicti (or Netsparker), Postman or similar
Candidates must be able to explain all vulnerabilities and weaknesses in the OWASP Top 10, WASC TCv2, and CWE 25 to any audience and discuss effective defensive techniques
Familiarity with industry standards and regulations including PCI, FFIEC, SOX, and ISO27001 is desired
Candidates must have excellent verbal and written communication skills
Keywords: Automation, Testing tools, OWASP, Application development, Application security, Gap analysis, Vulnerability, Risk management, infrastructure services, Penetration testing

Job Description:
We are hiring an Information Security Analyst to work in our growing IT Security team. You will monitor our digital environment for security issues, respond to security requests, install and operate security software, and document any security issues or breaches you find. To do well in this role you should have a bachelors degree in computer science and / or experience in the information security field.
The person reports directly into the Group Blue Team Lead Europe and works with all the different sections and locations within the IQEQ Group internationally.
The Group Information Security Analyst should develop and operate the activities below:
Monitor IQEQ networks, systems and applications for security issues.
Investigate security breaches and other cyber security incidents.
Operate security software to protect systems and information infrastructure, including firewalls, antivirus, SIEM, SOC and any applicable tools.
Document security breaches and assess the damage caused.
Respond to security request on MyIT.
Work with red team to perform tests and uncover vulnerabilities.
Fix detected vulnerabilities to maintain a high-security standard.
Stay current on IT security trends and news.
Assist Blue Team Leads while implementing security controls and understand information security management.
Research security enhancements and make recommendations to management.
Stay up-to-date on information technology trends and security standards.


Qualifications
Bachelors degree in computer science or related field.
Experience in information security or related field.
Experience with security solution administration
System network penetration testing and techniques.
Good knowledge of firewalls, proxies, SIEM, antivirus, and IPS/IDS concepts.
Comfortable with such solutions / tools :
Darktrace, Nessus, Acunetix, Nmap, Kaspersky AV, SCCM, Windows security, Cisco ASA, Cisco ISE.
Ability to identify network/system vulnerabilities and prepare mitigation plans.
Understanding of patch management with the ability to deploy patches in a timely manner while understanding business impact and system context.
Keywords: Patch management, Information security, SOC, SIEM, Antivirus, Windows, SCCM, Information technology, IPS

Job Description:
This position is housed under the Department of Health Care Finance (DHCF) in direct support of the DC Access System (DCAS). The Department of Health Care Finance is looking for a candidate who must be customer service oriented, have strong team and interpersonal skills, and ability to multi-task when required.

The Senior Identity and Access Management Systems Engineer will manage the IAM program and work with keep stakeholders to define, design, and build robust and highly available IAM Services. The primary role of the Identity/IAM Engineer r will be the implementation, deployment and maintenance of the Secure Authentication, Access Management Systems, and Identity throughout all DCAS functionalities.

The incumbent will define security requirements, identify the appropriate configuration for each unique District environment, and perform tasks associated with the day-to-day operations and maintenance on installed Cyber Security systems and applications.

The incumbent will partner with system and application teams to develop/create Enterprise Architecture integration strategies that allow secure access across district programs and applications related to DCAS.

The incumbent will have excellent oral, written, and presentation skills as a mandatory requirement.

The candidate will be the technical lead in the actualization of a robust IAM access program.

The candidate will work to position the organization for success, improving efficiency, accuracy, and compliance while increasing business responsiveness, improving security posture, and supporting aggressive growth

Core Duties:

-Design IAM processes and strategies to securely manage the identity lifecycle

-Design, implement, configure, and deploy IAM solutions

-Evaluate IAM solutions against business requirements and best practices

-Provide IAM subject matter expertise for business and technical project team

-Evaluate vendor solutions to ensure they meet technology and security standards

-Coach and serve as a technical escalation resource to team members on all IAM related technical issues

-Create and maintain design, technical architecture, and release management documentation

-Implement best practices for identity governance and administration, provisioning, de-provisioning, privileged access management, access reviews etc.

-Research and follow industry trends in the IAM space and provide recommendations that influence strategic plans

Technical experience in the IAM space, designing, implementing and deploying IAM services and infrastructure - 7 Years
Advanced understanding of Directory Services, AD, LDAP, and DNS - 5 Years
Experience implementing authentication methods, SSO, OAuth, MFA, SAML, Federation and Certificates - 5 Years
Working knowledge of IAM Oracle Identity Management - 7 Years
Experience implementing Identity and Access Management processes - 7 Years
Experience implementing role based access solutions - 7 Years
Excellent verbal, interpersonal and written communication skills - 7 Years
Prior experience as technical support to security technologies for implementation, evolution and operations of the authentication insfrastructure - Highly desired - 11 Years
BS/BA in MIS, Computer Science, or Security - 5 Years
Experience with Secure Authentication Systems, deployment and operation - 5 Years

Experience with Managed Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) Solution, deployment and operation is a MUST -5 Years
Experience with strong authentication technologies and protocols - 5 Years
Prior hands on experience with SSL - 5Years
Experience with Active Directory - 5 Years
Experience with LDAP is a MUST - 5 Years
Experience with Radius - 5 Years
Experience with NTLM, Kerberos authentication is a MUST - 5 Years
Experience/familiarity with one or more of these technologies: RSA Secure ID, Cisco ACS, SecureAuth, ADFS, OneLogin, Okta is a MUST - 5 Years
Keywords: LDAP, Access management, MIS, Active directory, DNS, Customer service, SSL, Release management, Technical support

Job Description:
Security & SOC analyst
1. Perform monitoring and data correlation to events of interest using multiple tools such as system event logs, SIEM, IPS/IDS logs, network traffic, anti-virus console and client end-point software to determine if there is an incident.
2. Respond to security incident and investigation requests in line with established processes and procedures within defined service level targets.
3. Must have extensive experience in multiple security areas such as SIEM, IDS and APT.
4. Drive containment strategy during data loss or breach events. Triage and resolve advanced vector attacks such as botnets and advanced persistent threats (APTs).
5. Perform basic forensic activities e.g. conducting examinations of computers, system logs, applications and networks to locate evidence.
6. Perform Root cause analysis (RCA) for the incidents and update the knowledge management.
7. Tuning of IDS, proxy policy, in-line malware tools based on threat feeds, trust and reputation data, incidents, or vulnerabilities and exploits of downstream systems.
8. Provide tuning recommendations to administrators based on findings during investigations or threat information reviews.
9. Research and stay up-to-date on current security threats and vulnerabilities to relevant information systems
Keywords: Security Analysis, Root Cause Analysis, Apt, SOC, SIEM, IDS

Company Name: Amerisource Solutions (a Unit Of S Ama Systems Inc.)
Job Description:
Job description
Position Description: As a Tier 2 SOC Analyst, the individual will be responsible for manning a 24x7x365 coordination center and responding to escalated alerts, notification, communications and providing incident response activities such as tracking the incident, communication with stakeholders, remediation and recovery actions and reporting. Ensure reports are properly entered into the incident tracking system and will coordinate with the reporting entity to gain full understanding of the event and details. Expected to have knowledge of cybersecurity incidents, anomaly analysis, log analysis, digital forensics, common threat vectors and be able to comprehend reports and determine what additional action and response activities may be required to resolve an incident. Follow established MGT/Cira SOPs, policies and other procedures for escalation and notification and reporting. The ideal candidate must have a strong understanding of at least one of Rapid7/ Securonix /CrowdStrike /TrendMicro /Splunk/Qradar SIEM and supporting Incident response tools.

Role & responsibilities

Perform incident response analysis uncovering attack vectors involving a variety, malware, data exposure, and phishing and social engineering methods.
Participate in the remediation of incidents and responses that are generated from live threats against the enterprise.
Recording and reporting all incidents per compliance, department policy and legislation.
Creating and tracking network incidents and investigations through completion
Serve as a point person for Incident Management, providing coordination and assignment of activity for all entities party to incident response event
Monitor security events received through alerts from SIEM or other security tools
Revise alerts escalated by end users
Carry out Level 2 triage of incoming Incidents (initial IR assessment of the priority of the event, initial determination of incident nature to determine risk and damage or appropriate routing of security or privacy data request)
Maintain assigned ticket queue
As needed, serve as the incident response person and liaison to enterprise teams, responding to crisis or urgent situations aimed at mitigating, preparing for, responding to, and recovery systems. Will also coordinate resources, activities, and timelines during security incidents to ensure a unified structured response to incidents (I.e., data breaches, ransomware events, etc.)
Review and recommend technical, process, and physical controls to counteract damage from breach events
Supports/develops reports during and after incidents, which include all actions taken to properly mitigate, recover and return operations to normal operations
Support forensic investigators and application security analysts in reactive and proactive Threat Hunting engagements, performing endpoint, network, and log analysis
Responsible for supporting clients in deploying SIEM solution by installing agents on endpoints, servers and integrating the log sources.
Managing the health of SIEM, EDR solution deployed for clients. Troubleshooting any issues identified within the SIEM and EDR platforms

Preferred candidate profile

5+ years of relevant work experience

Job Description:
As a Security Analyst, you will be responsible to use tools defined by our team to identify advanced threats, and then track and mitigate them before organizational IT systems are attacked. Advanced threats may constitute up to 10% of cyber threats, and not all advanced threats are detected solely with SOC solutions. Security Analysts are needed for that very purpose.
A Security Analyst continuously detects, analyzes and combats advanced threats. The job role includes detecting vulnerabilities and mitigating the associated cybersecurity risk before it affects the organization.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
In this role, youll get to
organize and analyze the collected data to determine trends in the security environment of the organization.
make predictions for the future and eliminate current vulnerabilities
review, administer, track, and escalate potential threats that occur and recur generated from various detection sources.
evaluate, suggest ideas, and improve current operational security processes, orchestration, response platforms and report generation by automation to improve operational efficiency.
REQUIREMENTS:
On day one, well expect you to
have at least 1 year of experience with incident response, security operations, malware analysis, developing custom detection in a variety of security appliances or threat hunting
have at least 1 year of experience with threat intelligence models and application to threat hunting
have an experience with programming/coding
possess effective oral and written communication, issue resolution, negotiation. Critical thinking and troubleshooting skills with a focus on analytical capabilities
must have basic proficient skills/knowledge in some of the following:
security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools - These tools are used to collect and analyze security event data from multiple sources to identify potential threats.
network Traffic Analysis (NTA) tools - These tools analyze network traffic to identify and investigate potential security threats such as malware, unauthorized access, and data exfiltration.
endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) tools - These tools are designed to detect and respond to threats on individual endpoints such as laptops, desktops, and servers.
threat Intelligence Platforms - These tools provide real-time information on emerging threats and trends to help organizations proactively defend against potential threats.
vulnerability Scanners - These tools scan networks and systems for known vulnerabilities that could be exploited by attackers.
deception technologies - These tools create decoys, honeypots, and other fake assets to lure attackers and alert security teams to potential threats.
forensic analysis tools - These tools help cybersecurity professionals investigate security incidents and determine the root cause of a breach.
have stable high speed internet >100 mbps
have a fully functional and up-to-date computer with which to perform duties
be willing to install next-generation endpoint protection on the computer
be a current resident of the Philippines and can perform work from there
be willing to work in US Pacific Time (8:00am-5:00pm PST) corresponding to 00:00am -9:00am PH time)
Nice to have
an intimate knowledge of Spiderfoot HX or recon-ng
at least a working knowledge of the cyborg-hawk platform
an understanding of common DAST tools such as burpsuite
Note:
This is a remote (work from home) position.
Keywords: Automation, Event management, Analytical, Security Analyst, Issue resolution, Forensic, Vulnerability, Troubleshooting, Security operations, Operations

Job Description:
Organization: Netrix Global
Job Type: Full Time/Regular
Title: Security Analyst -Tier III
Location: Pune, Mumbai, Kochi
Shift: Evening Shift


Roles and Responsibilities:
About The Opportunity

Netrix Global team is looking for an experienced Senior Security Engineer, Tier III to join our team and lead the implementation, maintenance, and optimization of our customers Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of cybersecurity technologies and methodologies, along with a proven track record of designing and deploying SIEM solutions in complex environments.


How You Will Make an Impact

Lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of SIEM platforms to ensure timely detection, analysis, and response to security incidents.
Develop and maintain security policies, procedures, and standards to ensure compliance with industry regulations and best practices.
Identify and assess potential security risks and vulnerabilities in our customers systems and networks and recommend mitigation strategies to the stakeholders.
Develop and maintain security incident response plans, conduct regular drills, and provide guidance to technical teams during security incidents.
Collaborate with other technical teams to ensure that security systems are integrated and optimized for maximum effectiveness.
Conduct regular reviews of SIEM performance metrics and make recommendations for optimization.
Stay current with emerging security threats and vulnerabilities and make recommendations for improvements to our security posture.
Lead and mentor junior security engineers and analysts on the team.


What You Will Bring to The Table

Bachelors or masters degree in computer science, Cybersecurity, or related field.
At least 5-7 years of experience in the cybersecurity field with a focus on SIEM implementation and management.
In-depth knowledge of security concepts, methodologies, and technologies such as intrusion detection/prevention, firewall technologies, threat analysis, vulnerability management, and security incident response.
Hands-on experience with SIEM solutions such as Splunk, IBM QRadar, ArcSight, or LogRhythm.
Experience with Security Automation implementation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, GIAC, or CEH are a plus.
If you are passionate about cybersecurity and have a proven track record of leading SIEM implementation and management in complex environments, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.


About Us

At Netrix Global our values are the philosophies and principles that live by. They support our vision, help us achieve our goals and commit us to a common purpose.
We Own Outcomes, Win Together, Make an Impact, Enjoy The Journey, and Respect All!
Netrix Global is a mission-driven organization with the goal of providing the people, processes, and technology needed to run and scale modern, data-driven businesses that are always on and always secure. Our breadth of capabilities allows us to provide holistic offerings that solve even todays most complex business challenges, delivering to you an integrated, optimized, and future-proof solution.
We work with clients of all sizes and specialize in solutions for healthcare, manufacturing, government, education, financial services, and legal industries. Netrix is consistently ranked in the CRN VAR500, detailing the countrys top system integrators.
At Netrix, were driven to solve business problems with innovative technology solutions. We focus on end-users and are committed to client satisfaction.


What You Can Expect from Us

We offer a competitive compensation package, comprehensive group benefits to meet the needs of you and your family, flexibility, and time off when you need it, and a casual work environment.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

To learn more about Netrix Global please go to www.netrixglobal.com
has context menuCompose

Note: Candidates who can join us within 15-20 days are preferred.
Keywords: siem, security, Arcsight, Sentinel, Ibm Qradar, implementation, Qradar, splunk, Logrhythm

Job Description:
Tasks:

Vulnerability Management (VM) - The role will provide application and VM
support for vulnerability scanning tool such as Rapid7 Nexpose. These items
can include access requests, manual scans, report generation, and general
troubleshooting and documentation. The support role will also assist in
updating bowlers, creating VM tickets and follow up with remediation owners to
obtain status of fix actions.

Incident Response (IR) - The role will review and close IR tickets in
incident automation/management application, attend one IR daily management
meeting per week for status updates, discuss metrics, questions, etc. The
support role will also utilize the application alert details to determine the
required remediation actions and assign to appropriate system owners. Lastly,
check the ticket status and verify that required action items were performed.

Provide access to security tools - The role will review access requests to
security tools (approve or reject), determine and configure appropriate level
of access to security tools.

Virtual Private Network (VPN) Support - The security team receives tickets
from associates who require access or are experiencing problems with using VPN
software. The support role will engage with the customer to troubleshoot the
issue and perform any necessary remediation action. This may include
instructing the customer s manager to submit a VPN request on their behalf,
modifying AD security group membership, teaching the customer how to properly connect, etc. Role will also be required to help associates with any additional
VPN requirements, such as multi-factor authentication applications, which are
required to successfully complete VPN process.

Issuing of TLS/SSL Certificates - We receive requests for SSL certificates
with some regularity that would need to be issued either from our internal,
Beckman PKI or from a third-party Certificate Authority site, such as DigiCert.
The support role would be responsible for soliciting a certificate signing
request from the customer and using that to submit a request to either
certificate authority and finally, deliver the certificate to the customer. The
role isNOT responsible for installing certificates on customer systems or
maintaining valid certificates on their servers. RoleIS responsible for fully
understanding certification technologies/terminology to help in providing
guidance to the user and troubleshooting of certificate workflow processes.

Microsoft (MS) Active Directory (AD) Account Lockouts - The support role will  review all tickets related to chronic AD user account lockouts to identify the
root cause. Typically, the global service desk will unlock user accounts,
however when it becomes locked out hourly for days at a time, there is usually
an investigation needed. Support role will work directly with the customer to
provide a resolution, which typically involves instructing the customer on
troubleshooting to determine root cause.

Lost/Stolen Assets - When employees report the loss of their Beckman Coulter
IT devices, tickets come to IT Security for analysis as security events. The
support role will be responsible for handling these tickets, coordinating with
various departments, and submitting a report. The process may involve checking
various systems, noting device configuration data, verifying with the
customer/manager/HR/IT Teams, and filling a report.

URL Whitelisting - The support role would be responsible for analyzing and
potentially whitelisting websites that customers identify as business related.
For example, our URL filters may unexpectedly block a vendor s website from
being visited. After reviewing the website and confirming it isn t malicious
using various methods, the site would need to be whitelisted in one or more
devices.

File Share Server Whitelisting - The support role would be responsible for
analyzing security tool data to potentially approve the whitelisting of port
445 for use by file share servers. Support role will ensure security agents are
installed, coordinate with system owners, and confirm vulnerabilities are
remediated. Once approval is given by support role, actual whitelisting is
completed network team as part of current workflow.

Documentation Updating - Support role is expected to create knowledge
articles and standard work, as well as update existing documents. These
documents help to standardize tasks and ensure all current documentation is
kept up to date.

Other taskings to be determined, around maintaining endpoint security
solution clients on machines, analyzing security tool data, and producing
reports that we would revisit later.

Qualifications for candidate with 5-9 years of experience:

Someone who has 5-9 of years of experience as a technical security
engineer or in doing general IT security support work. Someone with the
confidence and experience to make security related decisions based on security
data.

The ideal candidate would have advanced knowledge of Information Security
concepts (SSL/TLS, endpoint security, vulnerability management, security
investigations etc.) and a working knowledge of security infrastructure such as
VPN, Content filtering devices, firewalls, Active Directory, etc. Candidate
should also have experience in troubleshooting security/IT technologies. A
formal education in IT security or certifications would be a plus.

Additionally, they would need exceptional communication and critical thinking
skills, with the ability to translate technical terms to language our customers
would understand.

Must haves:

- Experience and confidence to work independently.

- Ability to analyze data and make security related decisions.

- Experience navigating and performing basic tasks in Active
Directory.

- Experience with MS Office applications.

- Basic understand of networking.

Nice to haves:

- Experience with Rapid7 s Nexpose Vulnerability Scanning.

- Experience with security automation tools such as
Demesto/CortexSOAR.

- Experience with Next-Generation anti-virus tools such as
Crowdstrike.

- Experience searching for security related data in Splunk.
Keywords: remediation, VPN, Information security, Active directory, Workflow, splunk, microsoft, MS Office, Vulnerability management, SSL

Job Description:
About the Role
As a Medical Device Security Analyst, you will support the Medical Device Security Team and their clients in assessing, developing, and implementing comprehensive medical device security programs and vulnerability assessment and remediation.
This will include working with the clients technical staff and medical device teams to understand specific risks related to the use of medical devices so that remediation plans and security programs can be customized to address risks found in unique environments.
The Ideal Candidate
Someone who can assist in medical device security risk assessments and develop vulnerability management strategies.
You will also help develop processes and associated documentation in support of developing clients medical device security programs.
Additionally, be able to write and deliver reports detailing your findings and associated recommendations for medical device security program development.
Successfully achieve high levels of client satisfaction on all engagements by achieving client expectations set by engagement leaders and project managers.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelors degree in business, technology, or information securityrelated field or equivalent work experience with medical devices and/or information security is a plus.
1 years experience with medical devices in a healthcare environment including lifecycle phases procurement, inventory and installation, ongoing support and maintenance, incident response, and endof-life management.
1 years experience with information security-related practices including incident response, risk assessment/analysis, and risk management.
Cursory knowledge of medical device cybersecurity principles and documentation (e.g. MDS2, FDA, AAMI, ICS-CERT reports, etc.).
Experience writing technical reports and presenting to non-technical audiences.
Relevant risk and/or security certification(s) required (CISSP, HCISPP, CISA, CISM, CRISC, CHPS, or equivalent).
Comfortable working in ambiguous and/or undefined situations.
Must be available for regular travel.
Keywords: Procurement, Cism, Cisa, Information security, Risk assessment, Management consulting, Healthcare, Information management, Risk management, Vulnerability assessment

Job Description:
A cloud security analyst is a professional responsible for ensuring the security of cloud computing environments within an organization. Their primary role is to identify and address security risks, vulnerabilities, and threats related to cloud-based systems, applications, and data.
Conduct security assessments of cloud-based infrastructure, platforms, and applications to identify vulnerabilities, risks, and compliance issues.
Develop and implement security measures, policies, and procedures to protect cloud-based assets and data from unauthorized access, data breaches, and other security threats.
Monitor and analyze security events and incidents in cloud environments, and respond promptly to mitigate risks and minimize potential damages.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including system administrators, network engineers, and software developers, to ensure cloud security best practices are followed throughout the
Perform regular security audits, vulnerability assessments, and penetration testing to evaluate the effectiveness of existing security controls and recommend improvements.
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends, emerging threats, and best practices in cloud security, and provide recommendations for enhancing the organizations cloud security posture.
Investigate and resolve security incidents, including analyzing logs, conducting forensic investigations, and documenting findings.
Assist in the development and delivery of cloud security awareness and training programs for employees to promote a culture of security awareness within the organization.
Participate in the design and implementation of secure cloud architectures, including identity and access management, encryption, network security, and data protection mechanisms.
Collaborate with external auditors and regulatory bodies to ensure compliance with relevant security standards and regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, PCI-DSS).
Requirements:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related domain certifications such as Certified cloud security professional (CCSP), Certified Information Systems security professional (CISSP), Or cloud - specific certification (AWS certified security speciality, Axure
2+ years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Experience in cyber security/IT highly preferred. Excellent leadership, communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.
Keywords: Telecom, Cloud computing, Bfsi, Access management, HIPAA, Network security, Healthcare, Vulnerability, Penetration testing

Job Description:
The Application Security Analyst would work as security specialist exposed to ethical hacking and will work with the IT Infrastructure team. Primary objective is to prevent unauthorized access to data systems while ensuring privacy and protection is well maintained without compromising quality of application s service delivery. As an Ethical Hacker, the Analyst would spend his/her days attempting to breach application and network security systems and identify potential vulnerabilities in the system. The findings are to be done periodically; progress reports and action steps are to be made to the senior management without fail.
We expect the Analyst to be an enabler of compliance and quality, have a positive attitude and maintain inter-team harmony while involved in the process of information gathering and process adherence.
Key responsibilities:
Key responsibilities: Conduct Tests on Cloud Networks and Applications:
Perform security tests on cloud networks, web-based applications, mobile-applications (Android iOS) and computer systems.
Design these tests and tools to try to break into security-protected applications and networks to probe for vulnerabilities.
Keep updated on the latest methods for ethical hacking while evaluating new penetration testing tools.

Conduct Security Audits:
Use testing methods to pinpoint ways that attackers could exploit weaknesses in security systems.
Conduct network and system security audits, which evaluate how well the system conforms to a set of established criteria.

Analyze Security Policies Write Security Assessment Reports
Requirements (Qualifications / Experience / Competencies)
Requirements (Qualifications / Experience / Competencies) Qualifications
B.S. in Computer Science or Information Systems, or equivalent degree and/or experience.
Minimum 3+ years ethical hacking / penetration testing experience for web, API mobile applications aligned to OWASP.
Offensive Security Certified Professional OSCP or CEH V10 Certified
Experience using Security assessment tools

Key Technical Skills
Ethical Hacking, Penetration Testing, IT Audit, Cloud Security, Cyber Security, Network Security, Security Architect, Applications Security, Data compliance, Data Privacy

Others
Should be curious, analytic and possess deep attention to detail.
Proficiency with MS-Office, especially Ms-Excel and MS-PowerPoint.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Keywords: Security audit, Data management, Testing tools, Information security, ISO 27001, Network security, Business intelligence, MS Office, Information technology, Android

Job Description:
What you will be doing:
Monitor and actively investigate security events and manage incident response investigations across a range of computing environments, platforms and applications, including Windows, Mac, and Linux-based operating systems, public cloud infrastructure-as-a-service platforms, and third- party hosted software-as-a-service applications.
Conduct advanced threat hunting operations using known adversary tactics, techniques, and procedures to detect adversaries with persistent access to the enterprise; identify and prevent and/or investigate suspicious events through event, pattern, correlation, and behavioral analysis of data from a range of systems and applications.
Research, classify, and/or discover cyber intrusion/attack tools, techniques, and procedures as well as the adversaries that may be behind them.
Conduct digital triage and forensic analysis of compromised computing environments and systems
Investigate and analyze malicious code and/or malware by performing reverse engineering and code analysis.
Develop and maintain security incident response plans, runbooks, and other preparedness
documentation.
Coordinate across the Security and other internal teams as well as external partners, ensuring that response protocols or activities are carried out and that incident response objectives are achieved.
Research and consume threat intelligence and develop security telemetry/content development to improve visibility and detection of potential adversaries and persistence mechanisms.
Identify and implement automated incident response solutions via scripting, leveraging a SOAR platform, and/or via AWS cloud-native services.
Track and report on security incident investigations.
Research and train on current and emerging technologies, such as cloud orchestration platforms and abstract infrastructure services, in order to understand how to carry out the duties above in those environments.
What you will need for this position:
5-10 years of experience in security incident response handling and investigation, security engineering, or security operations
Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, or related degree
Moderate command line scripting or some coding proficiency (e.g., awk, python, etc.), particularly in support of digital forensics and incident response investigations
Familiar with cyber threat intelligence and how to leverage and incorporate threat analysis into incident response preparedness and investigations
Experience with investigating security incidents in AWS public cloud environments
Some experience with the AWS platform and services, such as Config, Security Hub, Lambda, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, S3, WAF, Guard Duty, Shield
Ability to adapt to a hyper-growth pace and changing priorities
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Outstanding oral and written communication skills; able to convey highly complex, technical information in pressure situations to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Familiarity with common classes of security tools used to hunt and investigate security incidents,
such as EDR and IDS solutions, digital forensic analysis tool kits, SIEM or other data/log analysis platforms, DLP, WAF, NGAV, and vulnerability scanners.
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of high traffic and other cloud-based infrastructures and how they affect security needs (i.e., cloud infrastructure, AWS, Serverless SOA architectures) would be a plus
Proficiency in Python or Java languages
Self-motivation and the ability to work under minimal supervision
Keywords: Computer science, Linux, SOA, Coding, Agile, Vulnerability, Windows, Security operations, infrastructure services, Python

Job Description:
We are looking for a Security Analyst for our SOC Administration team that will:
a) Monitor, maintain and troubleshoot health related issues relating to the SOC Tools.
b) Onboarding and troubleshooting of the devices and non-reporting devices.

Good knowledge of SIEM, SIEM Architecture, SIEM health check.
Good verbal/written communication skills.
Review of daily health check of SIEM components like collector, processor, console etc.

High ethics, ability to protect confidential information.

Job Description:
As an Infrastructure Security Engineer, you will partner directly with the Infosec team to lead the adoption, implementation and execution of security related policies, projects, and initiatives. This position sits with the Infrastructure team but will also have a seat at the table with the Infosec team.
Main Duties and Responsibilities:
Assess and build requirements for execution of Infosec driven initiatives.
Understand, implement, and automate security controls, governance processes, and compliance validations
Manage, design, integrate, and implement the PKI infrastructure utilizing both traditional and cloud based technologies.
Communicate requirements and effort needed to execute on security initiatives to all stakeholders.
Perform system security administration on designated technology platforms, including operating systems, applications and network security devices, in accordance with the defined policies, standards and procedures of the organization, as well as with industry best practices and vendor guidelines.
Perform installation and configuration management of security systems and applications, including policy assessment and compliance tools, network security appliances and hostbased security systems.
Execute as an Infrastructure technical lead on small Infosec driven initiatives.
Act as a project manager to execute larger initiatives when needed, coordinating with all Stakeholders and keeping everyone informed regularly.
Apply patches where appropriate and, at the direction of Security Architect, remove or otherwise mitigate known control weaknesses, such as unnecessary services or applications or redundant user accounts, as a means of hardening systems in accordance with security policies and standards.Create and maintain standard work documentation for repeatable processes.
  Respond to and, where appropriate, resolve or escalate reported security incidents.
Create and maintain documentation for all related infrastructure as needed.
Track work in the ITSM solution, Jira, and Innotas.
Assess infrastructure initiatives to ensure they are following best practice guidelines as well as Infosec policies and procedures.
Identify and propose new solutions to better our security posture.
Partner with networking and cloud teams to provide guidance on firewall and security configurations.
Stay up to date on the latest security trends and work with Infosec to help drive communications when needed.

Minimum Requirement:
A minimum of 8 years of broad IT experience
A minimum of 4 years of PKI Infrastructure and Key Management support
Experience with managing vulnerability management tools and processes.
Experience with remediating vulnerabilities on Windows and Linux operating systems, and other infrastructure assets.
Experience working with application owners to facilitate patching and remediation activities.
Experience with AWS and other cloud infrastructure technologies.
Solid understanding of virtualization, server, and storage technologies.
Solid understanding of networking concepts such as DHCP, DNS, Routing, etc.
  Solid understanding of backup technologies and processes, Comm vault experience a plus.
Experience managing and maintaining Windows and Linux servers in an enterprise environment.
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
A keen interest in new technologies and open source
Knowledge in Infrastructure automation, build automation and deployment automation

Behavioral Skills:
Participate in all maintenance activities including verification and validation.
Excellent Oral and Written communication.
Be a good team worker demonstrating loyalty and commitment to the organization and team members.
Good organizational and communication skills and excellent attention to details.
Interact with individuals to provide needed information.
Able to handle multiple complex assignments simultaneously.
Ensures timely response to client and internal peers
Keywords: SAN, Linux, Networking, Information security, Configuration management, DNS, Windows, Open source, CRM, Firewall

The person reports directly into the Group Blue Team Lead Europe and works with all the different sections and locations within the IQEQ Group internationally.
The Group Information Security Analyst should develop and operate the activities below:
Monitor IQEQ networks, systems and applications for security issues.
Investigate security breaches and other cyber security incidents.
Operate security software to protect systems and information infrastructure, including firewalls, antivirus, SIEM, SOC and any applicable tools.
Document security breaches and assess the damage caused.
Respond to security request on MyIT.
Work with red team to perform tests and uncover vulnerabilities.
Fix detected vulnerabilities to maintain a high-security standard.
Stay current on IT security trends and news.
Assist Blue Team Leads while implementing security controls and understand information security management.
Research security enhancements and make recommendations to management.
Stay up-to-date on information technology trends and security standards.

Bachelors degree in computer science or related field.
Experience in information security or related field.
Experience with security solution administration
System network penetration testing and techniques.
Good knowledge of firewalls, proxies, SIEM, antivirus, and IPS/IDS concepts.

Darktrace, Nessus, Acunetix, Nmap, Kaspersky AV, SCCM, Windows security, Cisco ASA, Cisco ISE.

Job Description:
The Junior Cybersecurity Incident Responder has the primary responsibility for the company in responding to security incidents, either from alerts out of the security toolset, or escalated alerts from our MSSP

During high priority incidents the Incident Responder will direct the investigation and response activities of other security analysts, IT practitioners, and provide reporting and updates to Director level management
The successful candidate will be able to articulate themselves well, explain difficult concepts in ways that are easy to understand, be a team player, willing to admit when they are wrong or have made a mistake, be ready to always back up their words with data and solid analysis, and always be seeking opportunity to grow

Knowledge of AWS and Microsoft Azure environments and concepts is desirable.
Experience leading small teams is highly desirable.

Job Description:
About the Role
Security Operations Analyst is responsible for day-to-day security threat monitoring and analysis. The Security Operations Analyst manages security incidents and reviews security alerts for compliance and will work with senior analysts on known or suspected security threats. Security Operations Analyst will work on threat intelligence, forensics and incident response that adhere to best practices and recognized control frameworks.
General Duties and Responsibilities
Security Operations Analyst duties and responsibilities include:
The Security Analyst will be responsible for Implementing, administering, and maintaining portfolio of security toolset and solutions, including being the SIEM SME
Monitor and analyze daily security intelligence feeds and reports and adjust protections to mitigate new threats
Monitor, analyze, and interpret daily security events surfaced via dashboards, SIEM, IDS/IPS, etc.
Investigate and validate all actionable security events and escalate or take action as indicated in security model to mitigate threats
Participate in ongoing security operations and incident response activities
Keep abreast of and evaluate emerging technologies related to security, compliance, and risk assessments
Participate on the CSIRT (Computer Security Incident Response Team)
Assist in the review of applications and/or technology environments during the development or acquisition process to (a) assure compliance with corporate security polices and directions and (b) assist in the overall integration process regarding the technology environment whether it s on premise or cloud based
Educate the workforce about threats, vulnerabilities, and risks
Provide subject matter expertise and technical risk management to IT design and engineering efforts, covering diverse areas such as encryption, authentication, authorization, data integrity and resilience.
Manage and support the log collection, security scanning, intrusion detection, content filtering, and other security-related systems.
Review and triage information security alerts, provide analysis, determine and track remediation, and escalate as appropriate.
Provide support for the log management and security information and event management (SIEM) solutions.
Ensure authorized access by investigating improper access, revoking access, reporting violations, and monitoring information requests.
Detect and respond to malicious behavior on cloud systems, SaaS, workstations, servers, and networks.
Optimizes threat detection products for data loss prevention (DLP), security information and event management (SIEM), advanced email protection, endpoint detection and response (EDR), antivirus, cloud security products, intrusion detection systems, and other industry standard security technologies.
Proactively hunting threats within our environment
Write detection signatures, tune systems / tools, develop automation scripts and correlation rules.
Maintain knowledge of adversary tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTP)
Conduct forensic analysis on systems and engage third-party resources as required.
About you
Educational and Certification Requirements
Bachelor s in Computer Science, Information Security, Information Technology, or related field.
Certifications including but not limited to below listed.
CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional)
GCFE (GIAC Certified Forensic Examiner)
GCIH (GIAC Certified Incident Handler)
CRISC (Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control )
OSCP (Offensive Security Certified Professional )
Experience working with cloud technologies ( Azure, AWS, SaaS, etc.) is highly desired.
General Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
As well as formal qualifications, a Security Operations Analyst should possess:
Experience in forensics, malware analysis, threat intelligence
Ability to understand, modify and create threat detection rules within a SIEM
Knowledge and experience with the Windows and Linux operating systems
Experience using Python, Perl, PowerShell, or an equivalent language
Experience with network forensics and associated toolsets and analysis techniques
Experience with host-based detection and prevention suites (Microsoft SCEP, Carbon Black Response, OSSEC, etc.)
Ability to reverse engineer malware is a plus.
Understanding of log collection and aggregation techniques, Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana (ELK), syslog-NG, Windows Event Forwarding (WEF), etc.
Ability to correlate data from multiple data sources to create a more accurate picture of cyberthreats and vulnerabilities.
Keywords: Automation, Linux, Information security, Consulting, Perl, HTTP, Windows, microsoft, Information technology, Python

You will be responsible for providing technical support to security analysts and incident response teams who use the use cases you develop. This may include troubleshooting issues, providing guidance on how to use the use cases effectively, and answering technical questions.
Stay up to date with the latest security trends, threats, and techniques to ensure that the use cases you develop are effective and relevant.

Job Description:
About Position

The IBM XDR + SOAR Implementation Specialist is responsible for planning, designing, deploying, and optimizing IBM XDR and SOAR solutions within an organization's cybersecurity infrastructure.
This role plays a critical part in enhancing threat detection, incident response, and overall security operations.

Job Location: All PSL Location
Job Reference ID:  PSL201771_1-1-2

What you'll do

Solution Planning and Design: Collaborate with cybersecurity teams and stakeholders to assess security needs and design IBM XDR and SOAR solutions that align with the organization's security strategy.
Implementation and Deployment: Configure and deploy IBM XDR and SOAR platforms, ensuring they integrate seamlessly with existing security technologies and systems.
Set up and maintain the necessary infrastructure to support XDR and SOAR solutions.
Threat Detection and Response: Utilize IBM XDR tools to proactively detect and analyze threats across various data sources.
Develop and optimize playbooks and workflows within the SOAR platform to automate and orchestrate incident response processes.
Integration and Collaboration: Integrate IBM XDR and SOAR solutions with other security tools, such as SIEM systems, firewalls, and endpoint security platforms.
Collaborate with security analysts and incident responders to ensure effective use of XDR and SOAR technologies.
Performance Monitoring and Optimization: Continuously monitor the performance of XDR and SOAR systems and adjust optimize their effectiveness.
Stay up-to-date with emerging threats and cybersecurity trends to enhance the organizations security posture.
Documentation and Reporting: Maintain comprehensive documentation of XDR and SOAR configurations, playbooks, and workflows.
Generate regular reports and metrics to evaluate the impact and effectiveness of implemented solutions.
Security Compliance: Ensure that XDR and SOAR implementations adhere to relevant security standards and compliance requirements.
Assist in security audits and assessments as required.

Expertise you'll bring

Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Information Security, Computer Science) or equivalent work experience.8-12 Years experience in cyber security with good hands-on experience in SOAR and XDR deployment.
Strong understanding of cybersecurity principles, threat detection, and incident response methodologies.
Proficiency in scripting and automation languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell).
Experience with IBM XDR and SOAR platforms, such as IBM Security QRadar and Resilient, is highly desirable.
Strong problem-solving, communication, and teamwork skills.

Benefits

Competitive salary and benefits package
Culture focused on talent development with quarterly promotion cycles and company-sponsored higher education and certifications
Opportunityl to work with cutting-edge technologies
Employee engagement initiatives such as project parties, flexible work hours, and Long Service awards
Annual health check-ups
Insurance coverage: group term life, personal accident, and Mediclaim hospitalization for self, spouse, two children, and parents

Our company fosters a values-driven and people-centric work environment that enables our employees to:

Accelerate growth, both professionally and personally
Impact the world in powerful, positive ways, using the latest technologies
Enjoy collaborative innovation, with diversity and work-life well-being at the core
Unlock global opportunities to work and learn with the industrys best

Let's unleash your full potential. See Beyond, Rise Above
Keywords: IBM XDR, SIEM systems, IBM Security QRadar Resilient, firewalls, endpoint security platforms., SOAR platforms

Job Description:
About Position

A Threat Hunter is a skilled cybersecurity specialist dedicated to actively seeking out and identifying security threats, vulnerabilities, and potential risks within an organization's IT environment.
This role involves using a combination of cybersecurity tools, techniques, and expertise to detect and respond to advanced threats.

Job Location: All PSL Location
Job Reference ID:  PSL201771_1-6-1

What you'll do

Threat Identification and Analysis: Proactively search for signs of malicious activities, anomalies, and indicators of compromise (IOCs) within the network and systems.
Conduct in-depth analysis of network traffic, logs, and security data to uncover hidden threats and vulnerabilities.
Incident Detection and Response: Detect, investigate, and respond to security incidents in a timely and effective manner.
Collaborate with incident response teams to contain and mitigate identified threats.
Threat Intelligence Integration: Stay up-to-date with the latest threat intelligence feeds, trends, and emerging threats.
Incorporate threat intelligence into the threat-hunting process to enhance detection capabilities.
Tool and Technology Utilization: Utilize a variety of cybersecurity tools, including SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) systems, EDR (Endpoint Detection and Response) solutions, network traffic analysis tools, and threat-hunting platforms.
Develop and maintain custom scripts or tools for threat-hunting activities.
Continuous Monitoring: Implement continuous monitoring processes to ensure ongoing threat detection and response. Create and manage alerts and alarms based on hunting findings and threat intelligence.
Reporting and Documentation: Document findings, investigation details, and remediation actions taken.
Generate reports and provide insights to stakeholders and leadership on the threat landscape and potential risks.
Collaboration and Training: Collaborate with other cybersecurity professionals, including SOC (Security Operations Center) analysts and incident responders.
Provide guidance and training to security teams on threat-hunting techniques and best practices.

Expertise you'll bring

Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Information Security, Computer Science) or equivalent work experience.8-12 years of experience in cybersecurity, including experience in incident response, security analysis, or penetration testing.
Proficiency in using threat hunting tools and techniques.
Strong knowledge of cybersecurity principles, threat actors, and attack vectors.
Familiarity with various operating systems, network protocols, and security technologies.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Relevant certifications such as Certified Threat Intelligence Analyst (CTIA), Certified Incident Handler (GCIH), or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) may be advantageous."

Benefits

Competitive salary and benefits package
Culture focused on talent development with quarterly promotion cycles and company-sponsored higher education and certifications
Opportunityl to work with cutting-edge technologies
Employee engagement initiatives such as project parties, flexible work hours, and Long Service awards
Annual health check-ups
Insurance coverage: group term life, personal accident, and Mediclaim hospitalization for self, spouse, two children, and parents

Accelerate growth, both professionally and personally
Impact the world in powerful, positive ways, using the latest technologies

Job Description:
As the SOC Operations Manager, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the security of our organization's sensitive legal information and technology systems. You will lead a distributed team of security analysts, working in a hybrid model with team members both in-office and remote, to deliver seamless security operations.
Your responsibilities will include managing security incidents, overseeing the integration of security measures for acquisitions.

Key Responsibilities:
 Lead and manage a distributed team of security analysts, ensuring effective coordination and communication across time zones and locations.  Monitor security alerts and incidents, ensuring swift response, investigation, and resolution in alignment with best practices and legal industry standards.  Collaborate closely with legal and IT teams to assess and implement security measures to safeguard sensitive legal information and uphold data protection regulations.  Provide expertise in security operations for acquisitions, conducting thorough assessments of acquired company's security infrastructure and coordinating integration efforts.  Develop and implement security policies, procedures, and standards that align with legal industry requirements and international regulations.  Manage the security incident response process, including containment, eradication, and recovery, while maintaining proper documentation and reporting.  Plan and lead phishing simulation campaigns and ensure remedial actions will be implemented.  Stay up-to-date with emerging security threats, vulnerabilities, and industry trends, and apply this knowledge to enhance the organization's security posture.  Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the SOC team, driving innovation and efficiency in security operations.  Provide mentorship and guidance to team members, enabling their professional growth and skill development.  Security Threats: The SOC Manager will be responsible for leading the team to be vigilant against a wide range of security threats, including cyberattacks, data breaches, insider threats, and more. A robust incident response plan should be in place to address any potential security incidents promptly.

Qualifications and Experience:  Bachelor's degree in Information Security, Computer Science, or a related field; relevant certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISM, CISA) are a plus.  Proven experience (5+ years) in security operations, preferably within the legal industry or a similarly regulated environment.

 Strong knowledge of security technologies, tools, and methodologies, with hands-on experience in incident response, threat detection, and vulnerability management.  Experience managing remote teams and working within a hybrid work environment.  Familiarity with international data protection regulations, including GDPR, and their implications for legal industry data security.  Demonstrated experience in supporting security operations during acquisitions, including due diligence and integration efforts.  -Strong experience administering phishing simulation campaigns.  Excellent communication, leadership, and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across crossfunctional teams and time zones.  Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities, with a keen attention to detail.
Keywords: Security Operations, and vulnerability management., threat detection, incident response
