Job Description:
The Cybersecurity Engineer is a high impact role and will be responsible for improving Clario s overall security capabilities and maturity
To do so, the engineer will work with teams across the enterprise to solve complex problems in innovative ways
We optimize for agility and speed, so we are looking for a professional with a well-rounded profile, strong foundations and a desire to learn new things
The ideal candidate should have a broad background in enterprise security services such as Network and Endpoint Security as well as Identity and Access Management
The individual will also be responsible for configuring and managing some of our security tooling such as CyberArk
This is a hands on role requiring both good communication skills as well as technical knowledge
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
You will report to and work closely with Clario s Enterprise Security Architect to execute on a portfolio of projects which can span across the entire spectrum of Information Security domains. As Clario grows and refines its technology, the security team s work is never done! As the Cybersecurity Engineer, you will have the following core responsibilities:
Breaking & Fixing: Identify security problems and build, implement, and enhance high-quality solutions. Ensure Clarios systems and processes adhere to security and best practices for cloud, network, host, and identity management. Work across Clario to champion best practices in security.
Identify fit for purpose Solutions : Rather than compromise security, customer experience, or productivity, work to achieve the best of all three. Research and design ways to achieve risk reduction objectives in creative ways. Analyze current security tools and services to determine opportunities for enhancement. Proactively research new and emerging technologies and approaches to enhance the security posture of Clario.
Project Management and Delivery: Function as a technical lead and SME in various Information Security, IT, and projects as directed. Plan and direct projects to design and build foundational security controls.
Automation: Support functional teams to identify patterns that can be automated to ease the adoption of security controls and help the organization to shift left and achieve results and speed with acceptable level of security.
Configuration and Management: Configure and manage security tools (e.g. CyberArk) to achieve security goals. Establish the run-time management of security tools and processes for ensuring high availability, including deployment architecture, operational monitoring, backup and restore and managing centralized roles/rights. Implement and manage Privileged Access Management Platform (PAM).
Audit Support: Execute processes needed for compliance purposes (e.g. access reviews) and support other compliance tasks as needed
OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Other job related projects as assigned.
The duties and responsibilities listed in this job description represent the major responsibilities of the position. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned, as required. Clario reserves the right to amend or change this job description to meet the needs of Clario. This job description and any attachments do not constitute or represent a contract.
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS NEEDED:
(Key wording should include if degree is needed, any travel requirements, special qualifications needed, skills, etc.)
Education :
Bachelors in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems or related field. NOTE: May also consider Associates Degree based on relevant experience and certifications
Relevant Security Certifications are a plus (e.g. CISSP, CCSP, Security+)
Experience :
3+ years of overall experience in information technology including system technology, infrastructure, networking, cloud, and hosting services
1-3 years experience in one or more of the following roles: Cybersecurity Engineer, Cloud Security Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Network Engineer, Cybersecurity Analyst
Ability to assess and minimize business impact while strengthening security posture
Understanding of various security frameworks. Strong knowledge of all components of holistic security architecture and design and the ability to explain proposed solutions and recommendations to stakeholders from different technical backgrounds
Experience with identity and access management concepts such as SAML federation, OAUTH and MFA. CyberArk experience is a plus
Ability to manage one s time, focus and priorities in a fast paced environment
Strong ability to work collaboratively and build consensus across the organization
Excellent stakeholder management.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills with the ability to describe complex & abstract security and technical concepts to a non-technical audience
Keywords: Computer science, Automation, Networking, Project management, Information security, Stakeholder management, Operations, Information technology, Monitoring, Auditing

Job Description:
Job Description
Candidate should be able to drive SIEM & SOC setup and define processes and procedures for seamless monitoring of security events.
Candidate should have 6-10yrs of experience in implementing SIEM & SOC solutions and should be able to work independently.
Good experience on working on any one of the leading SIEM Solution providers - QRadar, Arcsight, Rapid7, ELK Stack or Splunk ES, but ELK stack would be preferred.
Building out the custom alert framework based on log ingestion using ELK stack, or other SIEM solutions. Should have ability to create custom queries, event parsers Searching and Reporting capabilities with SIEM Tool and create custom dashboards.
Demonstrable experience with raw log ingestion and verification from various data sources such as endpoints, network firewalls and switches, virtual infrastructure, servers, applications and cloud repositories
Should be able to Create, modify and tune the SIEM rules using ELK to trigger alerts on anomalous activities or threat detections and send notifications to SOC team.
Integration and troubleshooting of log sources
Proficient in incident response processes - detection, triage, incident analysis, remediation and reporting
Should have worked on SOC implementations
In-depth knowledge of security concepts such as cyber-attacks and techniques, threat vectors, risk management, incident management and threat hunting is mandatory.
Coordinate with and act as an authority to resolve incidents by working with other information security specialists to correlate threat assessment data.
Analyze data, such as logs or packets captures, from various sources within the enterprise and draw conclusions regarding past and future security incidents.
Working knowledge of industry standard risk, governance and security standard methodologies
Strong knowledge of Ansible or Python scripting, Linux CENTOS/ Red Hat operating system commands, file data storage, indexing, and searching via Elasticsearch.
Keywords: Linux, Information security, SOC, SIEM, Incident management, splunk, Troubleshooting, Risk management, Monitoring, Python

Job Description:
Job Responsibilities
You will participate in the development of larger modules which may also include requirements analysis, architectural design, or detailed design tasks.
You will operate independently to contribute to the development of new approaches and techniques.
You will participate in short term planning of engineering projects and programs.
You will execute development tasks on projects and will test to guarantee the technical quality of the solution and handle security vulnerabilities.
You will gather and analyze customer requirements.
You will be responsible for the analysis and determination of overall software design tradeoffs on a project.
You will be responsible for conducting, leading, and coordinating software development activities.
You will define and ensure the best solutions architecture and design in working with the development team and project manager.
You will streamline integration across projects, including task definitions, decomposition, and planning to ensure alignment of Thales best practices.
Contribute innovative ideas for technical improvements and business opportunities.
Be updated with industry trends, IT ops, and industry best practices, and be able to identify the ones we should implement.
Job Skills Qualifications
Strong hands-on development skills using C/CPP.
Strong experience with Linux -based infrastructures, Linux/Unix administration, and AWS, GCP
Strong development experience in Multi-threading.
Experience of working with software security analysis tools: Static code analysis tools (e.g. Coverity, Klocwork, HP Fortify), Dynamic analysis tools (e.g HP Web inspect), Vulnerability analysis tools (e.g Qualys, Nessus) and shall be able to analyze results reported by such tools.
Should possess good knowledge of security fundamentals and should have past experience of independently architecting or designing secure products or solutions.
Understanding of security transport protocols, tools, and libraries. Hands-on experience of working with one of them. E.g TLS, IPSec, DTLS, SSH, OpenSSL, JCA, MS CNG
Having exposure to system/solution designing skills.
Experience with project management and workflow tools such as Agile, Jira, Scrum/Kanban/SAFe, etc
Keywords: Software design, Linux, Project management, Consulting, Agile, Workflow, Telecommunication, SSH, Scrum, JIRA

Job Description:
Responsibilities
Monitor and analyze security information and event management (SIEM) for analysis and remediation of security issues.
Provide Tier I and II alert, triage, and remediation support and escalate within the SOC Tier 3 and above as appropriate.
Monitor and analyze network traffic, Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS), security events and logs
Prioritize and differentiate between potential intrusion attempts and false alarms.
Create and track security investigations to resolution.
Provide Incident Response (IR) support when analysis confirms actionable incident.
Run vulnerability scans and review vulnerability assessment reports.
Collaborate with other teams to assess risks and vulnerabilities and assist in remediation.
Stay up to date with current vulnerabilities, attacks, and countermeasures.
Integrate and share information with other analysts and other teams.
Manage Security Operations service desk and routine activity.

Required Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in a related field.
3 years experience as a Security/Network Administrator, Systems Administrator or equivalent knowledge.
Experience as a Windows or Linux Systems Administrator
Working knowledge of entire TCP/IP or OSI network protocol stack, including major protocols such as TCP, UDP, SMTP, HTTP, FTP, SSH, HTTP/HTTPS Linux/Windows system administration, along with network (router and switch), Webserver, firewall, or DNS administration
Knowledge of various security methodologies and processes, and technical security solutions (Firewalls, IDS/IPS, Antivirus/Endpoint Protection (Crowdstrike, Sophos).

Preferred Qualifications:
GCIA, GCIH, or other related certifications.

Core Competencies:
An ideal candidate should be able to demonstrate a general literacy of IT and cybersecurity, along with deep knowledge in areas related to CND
The Security Analyst must be enthusiastic, curious, and have a thirst for knowledge.
Ability to take ownership of and manage multiple events, tickets, and escalations and run them to ground.
Self motivated with a desire for constant learning and self improvement in areas of information security
Keywords: FTP, Linux, Information security, SOC, Consulting, Protocol stack, DNS, HTTP, Information technology, Firewall

Job Title: BDO Rise is Hiring - SOC Azure Sentinel mandatory - Senior Associate
Job Description:
Job Summary
This role is part of our Managed Services team to serve as the primary responder to security events within the Security Operations Center. The ideal candidate would have a strong problem-solving skills and analytics aptitude. This role participates in security posture monitoring and threat response activities and is directly responsible for troubleshooting security events. The preferred candidate will provide the initial analysis during security incidents, establishing the extent of the threat, business impacts and then advising and performing the most suitable course of action to contain and remedy the incident. The SOC Analyst must maintain a good knowledge of the threat landscape, help enhance current capabilities and provides support in the identification of new methods of detecting threats.
Job Duties
Monitor security event platforms and follow incident playbook for first response, triage, potential resolution and participate in post mortem activities as required.
Conducts network monitoring and intrusion detection analysis using various network defense tools, such as intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS), firewalls, host-based security systems (HBSS), Azure security and audit log management etc.
Provide proactive feedback to enable improvement of the current monitoring rules, based on information and knowledge/experience
Ability to react quickly, decisively and deliberately in high-stress, high-impact situations
Creates daily, weekly, and monthly report for Security Management Team
Performs front line response and escalation tasks and updates runbooks and procedures as needed
Compile statistics and contribute to the improvement and creation of playbooks
Use public cyber security resources (e.g. sites/blogs/podcasts) to stay up to date with latest news, threats, and security analysis tools
Shift Timing 2.00 PM to 11.00 PM IST

Experience
Two (2) or more years experience within cloud technologies such as Azure, Azure Stack Azure Backups, AWS or similar cloud experience, required
Two (2) or more years experience of network protocols, configurations, or operations required
Two (2) or more years of experience in infosec, cybersecurity, system or networking, required
Ability to triage problems, design and identify solutions and appropriately escalate issues in fast-paced environment, required
Some Experience with EDR platform or SIEM Platform, required
Prior experience with help desk ticketing systems and service desk management tools, preferred

KEYWORDS: SOC, Networking, Security, Intrusion Detection, Windows, Linux, Internet Protocol, Network Infrastructure, Host and Network Based Forensics, Antivirus Solutions, Troubleshooting, EDR Platform, SIEM Platform, Cyber Security, Cyber, Network Operations Center.
Keywords: Azure, Sentinel, SOC, Security Operations Center

We seek motivated self-starters and team players who are eager to collaborate, learn new things, and go the extra mile for our internal and external clients.
Essential Key Responsibilities/Job Summary
Defines strategies to drive data quality measurement, produce data quality dashboards and reports, and implement data quality strategies to effectively govern data and improve data quality
Design, develop and maintain scalable data transformation pipelines, complex customer use-cases
Serve as a technical expert on the design and architecture of new Data Quality platform
Work closely with Product Owners and Architects to understand requirements, formulate solutions.
Assist stakeholders with data-related functional and technical issues
Perform root cause analysis for technically complex issues with the goal of resolving the problem
Provide documentation and training on the use and support new Data Quality/Data Supply Chain platform to other internal teams as necessary
Lead and coordinate the team to ensure there is a focused customer delivery
Education/Experience and Competencies

Python - Required

Good understanding of CI/ CD stack including build/deployment tools like Jenkins, SCM (GIT, Bitbucket), Maven is a plus
Experience in complex Data formats like XML JSON and transforming the data within the same
Deep understanding of benefits and drawbacks of different design, architectural and integration patterns
Optimize solutions (ETL / data pipelines) to balance performance, functionality, cost, and other operational requirements
Define and promote best practices and standards for code management, automated testing, and deployments

Job Description:
Role & responsibilities

Report infrastructure issues to the IMS Team.
Working with vendors to work on security issues.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Strong security knowledge.

Knowledge and hands-on experience in management of IDS/IPS, Firewall, VPN, and other security products.
Experience in Security Information Event Management (SIEM) tools, creation of basic co-relation rules, and administration of SIEM.
Knowledge and hands-on experience in Log management & Endpoint detection and response tools.

Strong interpersonal skills including excellent written/verbal communication skills.

Job Description:
Description
Quotient Technology Inc (NYSE: QUOT) Founded in 1998, Quotient is based in Mountain View, Calif. with offices across the U.S., and internationally in Bangalore, Paris, London and Israel. Quotient is the leading CPG and retail marketing technology provider that delivers personalized digital promotions and ads to millions of shoppers daily.
Quotient uses its proprietary Promotions, Media, Audience and Analytics Cloud Platforms and services to seamlessly target audiences, optimize performance, and deliver measurable, incremental sales for CPG and retail marketers.
Quotient s powerful suite of capabilities includes personalized digital coupons, retailer - aligned dynamic ad messaging, influencer - led social media, data analytics and audience management. Quotient s audience data solution is powered by 100 million verified buyer audience, derived from its Retailer iQ partnerships.
By combining technology, data and distribution, Quotient serves hundreds of CPGs, such as Clorox, Procter & Gamble, General Mills and Kellogg s, and retailers like Albertsons Companies, CVS, Dollar General, Kroger and Walgreens.
Security Operations Center Analyst
You will be working in a positive, supportive, team - centric environment with otherSecurity analysts who are responsible for ensuring that the company's systems , network, applications and digital assets are protected from unauthorized access. This includes securing both cloud and on - premise infrastructures, weeding through metrics and data to filter out suspicious activity, and finding and mitigating risks before incidents occur. If an incidentdoes occur, security analysts areon the front line, leading efforts to counter the attack. You will identify and resolve security incidents and design supportable technical solutions which protect the availability, integrity, and confidentiality of sensitive information and assets and directly support compliance with SOC2, PCI, SOX and PII regulations.
Responsibilities:
- Overseeing security event monitoring, security incident report investigation, and incident handling
- Work closely with NOC team and help us build SOC tier1 framework.
- Providing forensic analysis in support of investigations and team when needed.
- Creating and maintaining rules, filters, dashboards, and reports in SIEM system to identify malware activity, misconfigurations, and/or anomalies.
- Researching the latest information security trends to understand the latest vulnerabilities and threats
- Conducting strategic analysis of existing, new, and evolving network security technologies
- Providing subject matter expertise to IT Compliance during IT internal and external audits
- Developing minimum standards and baselines to define required security controls and settings on all servers, commercial applications, and networks
- Assessing security risks to the organization's information and communications systems
- Designing, deploying,and supporting Security Solutions
Requirements:
- B.Tech/M.Tech/MCA with 2+ years of relevant experience in Information security
- Knowledge of vulnerability scanning using the Tenable Nessus system or other equivalent network vulnerability assessment tools
- Experience with one or more security product sets from the following: Palo Alto, Cisco, Tenable, Extrahop, Splunk, Akamai KSD and Imperva WAF.
- Working knowledge with SIEM tools like Splunk, Archsight, SIEMonster (ELK), extrahop, netflow, wireshark etc.
- Experience in malware analysis and remediation, and forensic analysis and remediation.
- Troubleshooting and configuration abilities with excellent TCP/IP networking skills.
- Awareness of Internet/Network Security technologies - firewalls, VPN, IDS, IPS, proxies, WAF, etc.
- Solid understanding of the underlying LINUX/UNIX and Windows OS security architecture.
- Ability to develop, describe, and communicate Security Baselines and Policies
- Excellent communication and technical documentation skills.
Good to have:

- Any industry standard certification such as Security+, CEH, CCNA Security would be a great plus but not mandatory
Keywords: Unix, Analyst, Linux, VPN, Information security, Network security, HTML, CCNA, Troubleshooting, cisco

Job Description:
The Cybersecurity Engineer is a high impact role and will be responsible for improving Clario s overall security capabilities and maturity
To do so, the engineer will work with teams across the enterprise to solve complex problems in innovative ways
We optimize for agility and speed, so we are looking for a professional with a well-rounded profile, strong foundations and a desire to learn new things
The ideal candidate should have a broad background in enterprise security services such as Network and Endpoint Security as well as Identity and Access Management
The individual will also be responsible for configuring and managing some of our security tooling such as CyberArk
This is a hands on role requiring both good communication skills as well as technical knowledge
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
You will report to and work closely with Clario's Enterprise Security Architect to execute on a portfolio of projects which can span across the entire spectrum of Information Security domains
As Clario grows and refines its technology, the security team s work is never done
As the Cybersecurity Engineer, you will have the following core responsibilities:
Breaking & Fixing: Identify security problems and build, implement, and enhance high-quality solutions. Ensure Clarios systems and processes adhere to security and best practices for cloud, network, host, and identity management. Work across Clario to champion best practices in security.
Identify fit for purpose Solutions : Rather than compromise security, customer experience, or productivity, work to achieve the best of all three. Research and design ways to achieve risk reduction objectives in creative ways. Analyze current security tools and services to determine opportunities for enhancement. Proactively research new and emerging technologies and approaches to enhance the security posture of Clario.
Project Management and Delivery: Function as a technical lead and SME in various Information Security, IT, and projects as directed. Plan and direct projects to design and build foundational security controls.
Automation: Support functional teams to identify patterns that can be automated to ease the adoption of security controls and help the organization to shift left and achieve results and speed with acceptable level of security.
Configuration and Management: Configure and manage security tools (e.g. CyberArk) to achieve security goals. Establish the run-time management of security tools and processes for ensuring high availability, including deployment architecture, operational monitoring, backup and restore and managing centralized roles/rights. Implement and manage Privileged Access Management Platform (PAM).
Audit Support: Execute processes needed for compliance purposes (e.g. access reviews) and support other compliance tasks as needed
OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Other job related projects as assigned.
Education :
Bachelors in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems or related field. NOTE: May also consider Associates Degree based on relevant experience and certifications
Relevant Security Certifications are a plus (e.g. CISSP, CCSP, Security+)
Experience :
3+ years of overall experience in information technology including system technology, infrastructure, networking, cloud, and hosting services
1-3 years experience in one or more of the following roles: Cybersecurity Engineer, Cloud Security Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Network Engineer, Cybersecurity Analyst
Ability to assess and minimize business impact while strengthening security posture
Understanding of various security frameworks. Strong knowledge of all components of holistic security architecture and design and the ability to explain proposed solutions and recommendations to stakeholders from different technical backgrounds
Experience with identity and access management concepts such as SAML federation, OAUTH and MFA. CyberArk experience is a plus
Ability to manage one s time, focus and priorities in a fast paced environment
Strong ability to work collaboratively and build consensus across the organization
Excellent stakeholder management.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills with the ability to describe complex & abstract security and technical concepts to a non-technical audience
Keywords: Automation, Networking, Project management, Information security, Stakeholder management, Operations, Information technology, Monitoring, Auditing

?Should have good knowledge of SIEM tools, Threat Intelligence, Malware triaging.
You Have All Our Desired Qualities, if:
?You like automating stuff
?You like writing tools
?You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to express your thoughts clearly
?You have the skill to articulate and present technical things in business language
?You can work independently as well as within a team
?You have strong problem solving, troubleshooting, and analysis skills
?You are passionate about your area of expertise and self-driven
?You are comfortable working in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment
?You are Self-driven, proactive, hardworking, team-player
?You are working on something on your own in your field apart from official work
Your everyday work will look like:
Alert handling: Analyse and tune security alerts and interpret security events that may lead to incidents.
Incident Response activities: Identity, investigate and respond to potential security incidents to minimize the operational and organizational impact.
Threat hunting: Actively pursue an abnormal activity on assets that may be signs of compromise.
Threat Intelligence: Leverage various threat intelligence sources and capabilities to enable an intelligence-driven response.
Malware Analysis: Analyse and interpret malware, exploit, and insider threat activities.
Forensics: Perform forensic analysis on memory, disk, and other system and network artifacts to identify indicators of compromise.
Identify Gaps: Investigate and document gaps in controls, event data, and work with internal teams to resolve.
Process Improvement: Execute, develop, and document Incident Handling Guides and processes.
Keywords: malware analysis, Automation, Networking, IT security, Process improvement, SIEM, Forensic, Troubleshooting, Operations, IPS

Job Description:
We help some of the largest brands in the world realize their business vision through a mix of strategic advice, expert systems integration, relevant technology recommendations and smart managed services. Our value proposition to our customers is that we bring thought leadership to the table in each of our domains, a passion for customer success, and an eye to risk management in everything we do.
RESPONSE:
Be a First responder for the true positive offense handed over by the security monitoring team.
Investigate by performing windows forensics on the infected endpoint.
Identify the initial infection vector
Perform threat intelligence and protection against threats including malware, phishing, hacking, etc. by consuming threat intelligence from a wide variety of sources, including but not limited to:
MSSP subscriptions, opensource community, independent security researchers community, cyber threat sharing forums, bilateral and multilateral sharing with peer client organizations.
HANDLING:
Liaise with the asset owner for the asset that is in question as part of the incident. (Via Phone call, SEPM alert mechanism, Email)
Inform the Asset owner s reporting manager about the situation
Inform the asset owner post completion of the IR investigation.
Collate the IR evidence and artifacts into the Ticketing system
Prepare detailed IR report
Handover the completed cases to the Security monitoring team for closure
Identify and track lessons learned as part of IR to eliminate any residual risks/threats that may be in the client environment.
THREAT HUNTING AND FORENSICS:
Log mining and identifying threats, Malware analysis, and reverse engineering.
Document vulnerabilities and Exploits used while analysing malware.
Analyse, evaluate, and document malicious code behaviour.
Identify commonalities and differences between malware samples for purposes of grouping or classifying for attribution purposes.
Researching Vulnerabilities, exploits, zero-day Malware, and then providing early alerts to Endpoint Security / IT Security team along with mitigation strategy.
Research and write actionable reports.
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of information throughout reporting.
Impart training to internal team members on Reverse Engineering.
Participate in directed research and development tasks.
Complete other tasks as directed by the respective Lead / Manager.
Develop tools to identify a 0-day malware based on various characteristics of a file format.
Assist the Lead / Manager in developing and setting up frameworks for developing an incident response toolkit.
EDR Analyst:
Hands-on experience in security incident response lifecycle and its phases
Hands-on experience in static and dynamic malware analysis
Hands-on experience in event and log analysis on Windows endpoints
Requirements
8-10 years of experience
Very good communication skills
At least 10 years of technical experience in Information Security, System Administration, or Network Engineering with at least 5 years of experience in Information Security.
Experience in Security Operations and Incident Response.
Detailed practical knowledge of Internet protocols, firewalls, load balancers, routers, switches, intrusion detection/prevention systems.
Ability to conduct multi-step breach and investigative analysis to trace the dynamic activities associated with advanced threats.
Knowledge of configuration of firewalls, load balancers, routers, and switches. Advanced knowledge and expertise of using SIEM technologies for event investigation
Keywords: Ticketing, Networking, Linux, Senior Analyst, Information security, Windows, CCNA, microsoft, Risk management, CRM
